Dec. garb. agn. et lane tocius paroch. de Estryngton. Et de 22li. rec. de Will'o Lowson pro decima garb. agnor. et lane tocius parochie de Estryngton.
Summa, 22li.
Dec. Magn. Claus. juxta Houghall. De decim. magne clausure juxta Houghall, nichil hoc anno, quia non seminata, tamen r. sol. p. ann. 40s. (10s., 1511).
Summa, nulla.
Summa totalis Recepte, 1462li. 11s. 11d. ob.
Superplus. In primis idem computat in superplus ultimi compoti precedentis, ut patet in pede ejusdem, 843li. 18s. 9d. ob.
Summa patet.

Garderoba Specialis. In primis, idem computat in solucione facta Georgio Heddon de Dunelm. pro uno panno integro et 3 uln. empt. pro monachis Officiar. 4li. 10s. Et sol. d'no Priori pro 6 uln. panni nigri, prec. uln. 4s., 24s. Et sol. pro 2 di. pannis integris panni coloris, emptis pro vestura (tam) clericorum quam laicorum generosorum, prec. singuli panni 53s. 4d., 6li. 13s. 4d. Et sol. pro 6 pannis integris panni coloris empt. pro vestura (tam) clericorum valectorum quam laicorum, prec. singuli panni 46s. 8d., 14li. Et sol. pro 7 pannis integris panni coloris empt. pro vestura Gromorum, prec. singuli panni 40s., 14li. Et sol. d'no Priori pro tribus furruris ad 18d., 4s. 6d. Et sol. pro 13 furruris nigris et di. empt. pro monachis officiar. prec. singule furrure 18d., 20s. 3d. Et sol. d'no Will'o Brantyngham, senescallo, et d'no Thome Hawkwell, capellano, pro eorum cucullis, 13s. 5d.
Summa, 42li. 5s. 7d.

Empcio Vini. Et in uno dolio vini Rubii et Clareti empt. de Relicta Swynburn de Novo Castro hoc anno, 5li. Et in 6 doliis vini empti de Jacobo Lauson de eadem (sic) ad 5li. 6s. 8d., 32li. Et in 2 hoggeshed vini empt. de Rob'to Brandlyng de eadem hoc anno, 60s. Et in 2 hoggeshed vini empt. de Xpof. Kare et Georgio Bartram de eadem ad diversa precia, 51s. 8d. (Verso) Et in vino Clareto et le Wyn seake empt. in villa Dunelm. et Novo Castro diversis vicibus hoc anno, 12s. 9d.
Summa, 43li. 4s. 5d.

Empcio Equorum. Et in uno equo empt. de Thoma Nixson, de Dunelm. pro Thoma Yngland veridario, In these entries we are probably to understand "veredarius," a carter, not "viridarius," a forester. 17s. Et in uno equo empt. per Joh'em Harper de Byllyngham pro Nicholao Pykeryng viridario, In these entries we are probably to understand "veredarius," a carter, not "viridarius," a forester. 26s. 8d. Et in 1 equo empt. de Relicta Nicholai Pykeryng, pro Joh'e Cottes viridario, In these entries we are probably to understand "veredarius," a carter, not "viridarius," a forester. 14s.
Summa, 57s. 8d.

Empcio frumenti. Et in 4 qar frumenti empt. de tenentibus de Dalton hoc anno ad 8s., 32s. Et in 4 bus. fru. empt. de Relicta Thome Chilton de Estrannton ad 15d., 5s. Et in 1 di. qar fru. empt. de tenentibus de Moreslay ad 8s., 12s. Et in 5 di. qar 3 bus. fru. empt. de tenentibus de Hesylden ad 8s., 47s. Et in 3 qar fru. empt. de firmario manerii ibidem ad 10s., 30s. Et in 10 qar fru. empt. de tenentibus de Coupon ad 8s., 4li. Et in 8 di. qar fru. empt. de tenentibus de Newton ad 8s., 68s. Et in 13 qar fru. empt. de tenentibus de Wolueston ad diversa precia hoc anno, 5li. 8s. Et in 12 di. qar fru. empt. de tenentibus de Byllyngham ad 8s., 5li. Et in 6 qar 1 bus. fru. emp. de tenentibus de Fery super montem ad 9s. 4d., 57s. 2d. Et in 8 qar fru. empt. de Wyllyngton ad 5s. 4d., 42s. 8d. Et in 7 qar fru. emp. de tenentibus de Walleshend ad 5s. 4d., 37s. 4d. Et in 4 qar fru. empt. de Roberto Smethers de Dunelm. ad 13s. 8d., 58s. 8d. Et in 4 qar fru. emp. de Nich'o Newsham de eadem ad 14s. 8d., 58s. 8d. Et in 1 di. qar fru. empt. de Thoma Dixson de eadem ad 12s., 18s. Et in 8 qar siliginis empt. de Jacobo Lauson de Novo Castro ad 12s., 4li. 16s. Et in 5 qar siliginis empt. de Will'o Care de eadem ad 10s., 50s. Et in 3 qar di. siliginis empt. de Relicta Swynburne de eadem ad 9s. 4d., 32s. 8d. Et in 1 qar 2 bus. siliginis empt. de Edwardo Baxter de eadem, 11s. 8d. Et in 10 di.
qar et 1 bus. fru. et siliginis empt. de Rob'to Tempest apud Kymylsworth ad diversa precia, 6li. 12s. 9d. Et in 22 qar 2 bus. fru. empt. de Thoma Casson de Houghton ad 14s. 8d., 16li. 8s. Et in 10 qar fru. empt. de magistro Lambert de Owleton ad 13s. 4d., 6li. 13s. 4d. Et in 4 qar fru. empt. de Relicta Lax de Chilton ad 13s. 4d., 53s. 4d. Et in 4 qar 2 bus. fru. empt. de Relicta Coleȝer de Hessewelgraunge ad 13s. 4d., 56s. 8d. Et in 4 qar 2 bus. fru. empt. apud Stokton per Thomam Chapman et Joh'em Harper hoc anno ad diversa precia, 48s. 8d. Et in 12 qar fru. empt. de firmario manerii de Bewley ad 10s. 8d., 6li. 8s. Et in 1 di. qar 3 bus. fru. empt. de molend. de Newton ad 10s., 18s. 9d. Et in 16 qar fru. empt. apud Hartylpolle de Will'o Kyngson de Grymsbye per Nicho∣laum Newsham et Thomam Wederall ad diversa precia, 8li. 4s. 4d. Et in 2 qar fru. empt. de Hostillario ad 13s. 4d., 26s. 8d. Et in 70 qa fru. empt. de Joh'e Karre de Hull ad diversa precia, una cum expens. et naulo ejusdem usque Novum Castrum, 31li. 12s. 6d. Et in 18 qar fru. empt. in foro Dunelm. et de diversis in patria per magistrum Newsham, Thomam Spragen et Matheum (Spragen?) hoc anno ad diversa precia, 6li. 9s. 6d. Et in 9 di. qar 1 bus. fru. empt. de decim. de Harton hoc anno ad 5s. 4d., 51s. 4d. Et in 13 qar 3 bus. fru. empt. de decim. villarum de Westow et Shellehough ad 5s. 4d., 71s. 4d. Et in 8 qar 1 bus. fru. empt. de decim. de Southwyk ad 5s. 4d., 43s. 4d. Et in 3 qar 1 bus. fru. empt. de decim. de Hepton super montem ad 5s. 4d., 16s. 8d. Et in 9 di. qar 3 bus. fru. empt. de dec. de Northsherburn ad 5s. 4d., 52s. 8d. Et in 22 qar 1 bus. fru. empt. de dec. de Byllyngham hoc anno ad 5s. 4d., 118s. Et in 12 qar fru. empt. de dec. de Coupon ad 5s. 4d., 64s. Et in 33 qar 2 bus. fru. empt. de dec. villar. de Wolueston et Newton hoc anno ad 5s. 4d., 8li. 17s. 4d. Et in 6 bus. fru. empt. de dec. de Heworth ad 8d., 4s. Et in 32 qar fru. empt. de decim. de Estmeryngton hoc anno ad 5s. 4d., 8li. 10s. 8d. Et in 27 di. qar 3 bus. fru. empt. de dec. de Fery super montem ad 5s. 4d., 7li. 8s. 8d. Et in 8 qar siliginis rec. de una clausura voc. Qwynnyclosse hoc anno ad 5s. 4d., 42s. 8d.
Summa, 187li. 16s.

Empcio ordii. Et in 14 qar 1 bus. ordii empt. de tenentibus de Dalton ad 5s. 6d., 77s. 7d. Et in 29 di. qar 1 bus. ord. empt. de tenentibus de Estrannton ad 5s. 6d., 8li. 2s. 10d. Et in 21 qar 1 bus. ordii empt. de tenentibus
de Westrannton hoc anno ad 5s. 6d., 5li. 16s. 1d. Et in 13 qar 2 bus. ord. empt. de tenentibus de Moreslay ad 5s. 6d., 72s. 10d. Et in 25 qar 1 bus. ord. emp. de tenentibus de Hesylden ad 5s. 6d., 6li. 18s. 1d. Et in 2 qar ord. empt. de Arch'o Hall, firmario manerii ibidem ad 6s. 8d., 13s. 4d. Et in 20 qar ordii empt. de tenentibus de Coupon ad 4s. 6d., 4li. 10s. Et in 4xx 3 di. qar ord. empt. de tenentibus de Newton ad diversa precia, unde 71 qar di. ad 5s. 6d., 19li. 13s. 3d., et 12 qar ad 4s. 9d., 57s., 22li. 10s. 3d. Et in 72 di. qar 2 bus. ord. empt. de tenentibus de Wolveston ad 5s. 6d., 19li. 19s. 11d. Et in 109 qar ord. empt. de tenentibus de Byllyngham hoc anno ad 5s. 6d., 29li. 19s. 6d. Et in 3 qa ord. empt. de tenentibus de Fery super montem ad diversa precia, 17s. 8d. Et in 110 qar ord. empt. de Roberto Dandbye de Wellez ad 6s. 6d., 35li. 15s. Et in 8 qar ordii bras. empt. de Will'mo Manderson ad 6s. 10d., 54s. 8d. Et in 11 di. qar 2 bus. ord. brasiati empt. de Will'mo Whetley de Lynne ad 6s., 70s. 6d. Et in 52 qar di. ord. bras. empt. de Will'o Nicholson de Hartylpolle ad 6s., 15li. 15s. Et in 24 qar ordii empt. de firmario de Bewley ad 26s. 8d. (sic, read 6s. 8d.), 8li., et 16 qar de blandcorne ad 20s. (sic, read 5s.), 4li., 12li. Et in 12 qar 3 bus. ord. empt. de dec. de Harton hoc anno ad 4s., 49s. 6d. Et in 18 di. qar ordii empt. de dec. villar. de Westow et Shelhought ad 4s., 74s. Et in 8 qar 3 bus. ord. empt. de dec. de Southwyk ad 4s., 33s. 6s. Et in 1 di. qar 3 bus. ord. empt. de dec. de Hepton super montem ad 4s., 7s. 6d. Et in 4 di. qar 2 bus. ord. empt. de dec. de Northsherburn ad 4s., 19s. Et in 37 di. qar 2 bus. ord. empt. de decim. de Byllyngham ad 4s., 7li. 11s. Et in 14 di. qar ord. empt. de dec. de Coupon ad 4s., 58s. Et in 49 di. qar ord. empt. de decim. villar. de Wolveston et Newton ad 4s., 9li. 18s. Et in 1 bus. ordii empt. de dec. de Heworth, 6d. Et in 12 di. qar 3 bus. ord. empt. de dec. de Estmeryngton ad 4s., 51s. 6d. Et in 4 di. qar ord. de decim. de Fery super montem ad 4s., 18s. Et in 37 di. qar ord. de havermaltes empt. de tenentibus de Byllyngham hoc anno ad 4s., 7li. 10s.
Summa, 217li. 3s. 9d.

Empcio aven. Et in 4 qar aven. empt. de tenentibus de Dalton ad 20d., 6s. 8d. Et in 17 qar aven. empt. de ten. de Estranton hoc anno ad 2s., 34s. Et in 29 qar aven. empt. de ten. de Westrannton ad 2s., 58s. Et in 6 qar aven. empt. de ten. de Moresley ad 2s., 12s. Et in
6 qar aven. empt. de ten. de Hesylden ad 20d., 10s. Et in 4 qar 2 bus. aven. empt. de Archo Hall firmario manerii ibidem, 11s. Et in 8 qar aven. empt. de ten. de Fery super montem ad diversa precia, 21s. Et in 3 di. qar aven. empt. de dec. de Harton ad 18d., 5s. 3d. Et in 3 qar 2 bus. aven. empt. de dec. ville de Westow et Shelhough ad 18d., 4s. 10d. ob. Et in 2 qa aven. empt. de dec. de Southwyk ad 18d., 3s. Et in 5 qar 3 bus. aven. empt. de dec. de Hepton super montem ad 18d., 8s. 2d. Et in 21 di. qa aven. empt. de dec. de Northsherburn ad 18d., 32s. 3d. Et in 5 qar aven. empt. de dec. de Byllyng∣ham ad 18d., 7s. 6d. Et in 6 qar aven. empt. de dec. villarum de Wolveston et Newton ad 18d., 9s. Et in 6 bus. aven. empt. de dec. de Heworth ad 2d. qa, 14d. ob. Et in 20 qar 1 bus. aven. empt. de dec. de Estmeryngton ad 18d., 30s. 2d. Et in 42 qar bus. aven. empt. de dec. de Fery super montem ad 18d., 63s. 4d. ob. Et in 9 qar aven. rec. de una clausura vocata Qwynnyclosse hoc anno ad 18d., 13s. 6d.
Summa, 16li. 10s. 10d. ob.

Empcio pis. et fabarum. Et in 6 di. qar pis. et fab. empt. de decim. de Harton ad 5s. 4d., Peas and beans being mentioned together as in this account probably shews that they were sown and reaped together, as, according to Rogers (Prices l, 27), they occasionally were. 34s. 8d. Et in 7 qar 2 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de decim. villar. de Westow et Shelhough ad 5s. 4d., 38s. 8d. Et in 2 qar pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Southwyk ad 5s. 4d., 10s. 8d. Et in 2 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Northsherburn ad 8d., 16d. Et in 12 qar pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Billyngham ad 5s. 4d., 64s. Et in 8 qar 3 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Coupon ad 5s. 4d., 44s. 8d. Et in 10 qar pis. et fab. empt. de dec. villar. de Wolveston et Newton ad 5s. 4d., 53s. 4d. Et in 4 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Heworth ad 8d., 2s. 8d. Et in 4 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Estmeryngton ad 4d., 2s. 8d. Et in 7 bus. pis. et fab. empt. de dec. de Fery super montem ad 8d., 4s. 8d.
Summa, 12li. 17s. 4d.

Empcio ferri. Et in 30 petr. ferri Hispanici empt. de Jacobo Lawson de Novo Castro ad 9d., 22s. 6d. Et in 100 petr. ferri de Wardall empt. de Ric'o Crosby de Rychemond hoc anno ad 5d., 41s. 8d. Et in 200ma 16 petr. ferri de Wardall empt. de tenentibus de Edmundbyrez et pastoribus de Mugleswyk ad 5d., 116s. 8d. Et in 4xx petr. ferri de stauro d'ni Prioris pro le Wodyron ad 4d.,
26s. 8d. Et sol. Henrico Bluntt pro operacione 300 5xx 6 petr. d'ci ferri in diversis ferramentis d'ni Prioris et Burs. hoc anno ad 2d., 77s. 8d. Et in ferrura equorum d'ni Prioris et Burs. ac servientium hoc anno, 6s. 11d.
Summa, 14li. 4s. 1d.

Dona et exennia. Et in Ordinibus fratrum ville Novi Castri super Tynam, cuilibet eorum, 13s. 4d. Et fratribus de Hartylpolle hoc anno, 3s. 4d. Et in diversis donis datis ministralis diversorum dominorum et portantibus ferinam et alia exennia, ut patet per billam d'ni Thome Hawkwell capellani, hoc anno, 10li. 6s. 8d. Et in diversis donis datis portantibus ferinam et alia exennia per manus Burs. hoc anno, 13s. 4d. Et in donis datis cocis ad festum Pasche, 2s. Et Cantori ad ludum suum, 20d.
Summa, 12li. 4d.

Expens. in ludis d'ni Prioris. Et sol. d'no Will'o Brantyngham, senescallo d'ni Prioris ad festum Pasche in precio 40 agnorum ad 10d., 33s. 4d. Et eidem in precio 9 porcorum ad 5s., 45s. Et eidem in precio Ml Ml allec. sor. pro 3bus ludis d'ni Prioris, 18s.
Summa, 4li. 16s. 4d.
Expens. Bursarii. Et in Expens. Bursarii hoc anno, ut patet in compotis precedentibus.
Summa, 40s.

Expens. d'ni Prioris. Et in diversis speciebus emptis per Camerarium d'ni Prioris hoc anno, 6s. 8d. Et in 6 lib. confect. empt. de Thoma Porter ad 8d., 4s. Et in 2 lib. sugrplate ad 8d., 16d. Et in 1 lib. licoric', 4d. Et in 6 lib. annessedes, 18d. Et sol. d'no Priori pro cucullis, bottis, tunicis, et aliis necessariis per tempus compoti, 100s. Et sol. lotrici pro stipend. per temp. comp., 3s. 4d.
Summa, 117s. 2d.

Elemos. consuet. Et in distribucione facta ad man∣datum D'ni ex consuetudine, 102s. 4d. Et sol. 4or viduis Beate Marie, 4s. Et sol. 15 fratribus de domo Dei pro eorum calciamentis, cuilibet eorum 16d., 20s. Et cuilibet eorum pro Garniamentis 18d., 22s. 6d. Et cuilibet eorum pro 1 pc salis 2d., 2s. 6d.
Summa, 7li. 11s. 4d.

Exp. necessarie. Et sol. in tonsione et locione ovium apud Mugleswyk hoc anno, 9s. 3d. Et in tonsione et locione ovium apud Holme hoc anno, 17s. 6d. Et sol. Thome Heryson et 6 sociis pro falcacione 127 diurnitatum infra parcam de Beawrpark in diversis locis ad 6d., 73s. 6d.
Et sol. pro dispercione, levacione, et lucracione feni ejusdem in Beawrpark per tall. Clementis Hallmude confect., 49s. 2d. Et sol. Matheo Robynson et 5 sociis pro falcacione 33 acr. prati super Pellowlez, Gelylez, et Hymidlegarthez, cum 1 selione super Pellolez quondam Roberti M'shall, viz. pro singula acra 6d., 6s. 6d. Et sol. eisdem pro falcacione unius claus. vocat. North Rauynsflatt ex convenc. facta in grosso, 18s. Et sol. eisdem pro falcacione 35 diurnit. prati in una clausura voc. Southravynsflatte ibidem ad 6d., 17s. 6d. Et sol. eiisdem pro falcacione de una clausura vocata Holcroft ex convencione facta in grosso, 10s. Et sol. pro dispercione, levacione et lucracione feni de Pellolez, Gelylez, Hyndle∣garth, Ravynsflatt, et Holcroft, ut patet per billam granatoris, 26s. Et sol. Americo Daund, Will'o Batman∣son, Thome Bannkes, et tenentibus de Shynkley et Esshe pro cariag. cmij plaustr. feni usque monasterium a Pellowlez, Gelylez, Hydlegarth, Ravynsflat et Holcroft hoc anno, unde 60 ad 4d., 20s., et 28 ad 6d., 19s., et 3 ad 2d., 6d. usque le Stake, 39s. 6d. Et sol. pro falcacione et lucracione feni provenientis de 3bus acris et di. prati in Frognall in manu d'ni existent. apud Byllyngham pro equis carect. supervenientibus pro diversis granis ab hinc usque monasterium cariandis hoc anno, 2s. 8d. Et sol. magistro de Jarrow pro dec. feni de Shelhough hoc anno, 5s. Et in expens. Bursarii et aliorum secum laborancium in comitatu Northumbr. pro dimissione et recepcione decimarum ibidem hoc anno, 40s. Et in expens. Jasperi Horsselay, Rob'ti Syme, et aliorum in colleccione agnorum et lane decimalium in Norhamshire hoc anno, 17s. 5d. Et in expens. Burs. et aliorum secum laborancium apud Shellez et alibi in patria pro negociis domus, una cum expensis trium Halmotorum infra tempus compoti hoc anno, 68s. Et sol. Cuthberto Pappe, Nich'o Pykeryng, et Thome Yngland, bigariis, pro expensis suis apud Novum Castrum, Shellez, Hebbarne, Hartylpolle, Mugles∣wyk et alibi in patria pro cariag. agnorum, ferri, salis, dogdr. et aliorum necessariorum per tempus compoti hoc anno, 39s. 5d. Et in expens. Rob'ti Syme pro piscibus recentibus empt. apud Ebor., 6s. 5d. Et in expens. Jasperi Horseley cursoris scaccarii d'ni Prioris equitantis in collectione firmarum in patria et alibi apud Novum Castrum in negociis domus, 12s. 4d. Et in expens. Rob'ti Whithed in Novo Castro pro vino eligendo, 2s. 7d. Et sol. portatoribus Novi Castri pro portacione vini, olei, mellis, bituminis, et aliorum necessariorum per tempus
compoti, 11s. Et sol. famulo magistri Mathoson de Hull pro naulo 10 barell. salmonum, scilicet a Bervico usque Novum Castrum hoc anno, 5s. Et sol. Thome Smyth et Edmundo Laynnge de Cestria pro cariagio vini, mellis, bituminis, allec. alb. et smygmatis a Novo Castro hoc anno, 45s. 2d. Et in 1 dd. cere ad 6d., 6s., et 2 dd. di. Resine ad 12d., 2s. 6d. empt. de Relicta Swynburn, 8s. 6d. Et Nich'o Browne pro factura 2 Torchez, 8d. Et eidem pro 1 libra cere rubie hoc anno, 12d. Et in 8 lib. le qwynna (sic) These words have perhaps been written from dictation, by mistake for lichini. empt. de Relicta Swynneburn de Novo Castro ad diversa precia, 2s. 4d. Et in 4xx 17 petr. cebi ad 12d., 38 di. petr. feod. coquine empt. de Cellerario ad 10d., 32s. 1d. pro candelis inde fiendis, cum unccione ovium, rotarum bigarum, plaustr., et molend. abbathie per tempus compoti, 6li. 9s. 1d. Et in candelis alb. empt. hoc anno, 6d. Et in lichino empt. per Nicholaum Newsham hoc anno, 7s. 8d. ob. Et sol. eidem Nicholao pro arefactione avenarum in lentibus hoc anno, 16d. Et sol. Rad'o Colpottes, Georgio Bluntt, Will'mo Graunge et Rolando Feuster de Dunelm pro cellis novis et emendacione aliorum, una cum frenis, stirropleders, sadletreys, et ceteris illis pertinentibus, captis et receptis pro stabulis d'ni Prioris et Bursarii per tempus compoti, 16s. 8d. Et sol. Stephano Lokesmyth de Bywell pro bridlebyttes, bukkeyles, spurres, pectinibus, una cum emendacione lez bossez, et wernysshynnge hoc anno, 8s. 8d. Et in 2 dd. girthweb empt. per Relictam Garstell de Aluerton hoc anno, 22d. Et sol. Thome Heghyngton de Dunelm. pro 10 wayneroppes ad 4d., 3s. 4d.; 3 par. pyntracez ad 8d., 2s., 3 par. mydletraces ad 6d., 18d., et 4 cartropez ad 4d., 16d., 1 dd. wametowshaftes ad 2d., 2s., 2 di. dd. heltrez ad 2d., 5s., una cum 1 reste empt. pro le wyndesse in pandoxatario hoc anno, 18s. 2d. Et eidem Thome pro 3 lib. le byndyng cum small cordes pro aque ductu, 5d. Et in 100ma 4 uln. panni linei empt. hoc anno ad diversa precia, unde 12 uln. ad 8d., 8s., 40 uln. ad 5d., 16s. 8d., et 72 uln. ad 4d., 24s., 48s. 8d. Et in 40 uln. panni le hardyng empt. de diversis in patria ad 2d., 6s. 8d. Et in 4xx uln. panni sacci empt. de Will'o Brekes et Will'mo Aland de Hemmyngburgh hoc anno ad 2d. ob., 16s. 8d. Et in 1 lib. Sewynnge hayr empt. de Rob'to Valyaunt, 4d. Et sol. uxori Xpof. Huchynson et (ux.) Cuthb'ti Johnson pro consuicione de le Napre hoc anno, 4s. 4d. Et in 1 di.
barell smygmatis empt. de Relicta Swynburn de Novo Castro hoc anno, 35s. Et in 4 barell' bituminis empt. de Relicta Swynburne de eadem ad 6s., 24s. Et in 4 lib. picis empt. pro rotis molend. de Scaltok, 8d. Et sol. Rob'o Bluntt et Clementi Dixson pro tannacione 6 pell. bov. et vacc. hoc anno, 4s. Et in 4 bus. salis grossi empt. in Novo Castro ad 12d., 4s. Et in 37 di. qar salis empt. de tenentibus de Coupon pro firma salinarum, superius onerat. ad 4s. le qar, 7li. 10s. Et in 7 di. qar salis empt. de Rob'to Kare et Relicta Taylȝor de Shellez ad diversa precia hoc anno, 26s. 6d. Et in pergameno (et) papiro empt. hoc anno, 10s. 6d. Et sol. Will'mo Morefeld et aliis pro seris et clavibus una cum emendacione aliarum infra et extra monasterium hoc anno, 6s. 4d. Et pro cribris, skepis, roppez, lepez, tribulis, et aliis necessariis empt. per billam granatoris, 6s. 3d. Et in 2 dd. poculis, 10d., empt. de Relicta Swynburne, et 1 dd. ciphorum empt. de Rob'to Rede, 5d., 15d. Et sol. Rob'to Wylkyson et Rob'to Foster pro 4or securibus et emendacione aliarum securium, et le layng per tempus compoti, 2s. 9d. Et sol. Jacobo Robynson pro mariscalcia et medicinis equorum ac cum 1 Roba hoc anno, 20s. Et sol. Hugoni Burn pro falcacione cirporum apud Holme hoc anno, 12d. Et in 1 pare calathorum empt. pro catori senescalli in ludis d'ni Prioris, 4d. Et sol. David Temple pro cariagio 1 seall ab Insula Sacra usque monasterium hoc anno, 2s. Et in expens. Rob'i Best et Americi Dande equitantibus ad nundinas apud Stagshaw, Darneton, Novum Castrum, Wolsyngham, Mugleswyk, et alibi in patria, pro empcione et minacione animalium per tempus compoti, 17s. 2d. Et sol. Ric'o Fraynche, Joh'i Baylȝay et Xpof. Newton, pro 1460 Burdnall' ad 4d., 4s. 10d., 100 leydnall' 5d., et 2000 latbroddes ad 2s. 1d., 4s. 2d., 9s. 5d. Et in 2 paribus molarum empt. de Thoma Cruk de Wolsyngham (pro) molendino de Shellez et Scaltok myln, 35s. Et sol. tenentibus de Byllyngham, 6s. 6d., Wolueston Newton, 4s. 2d., Meryngton, 6s. 6d., Fery, 9s., pro cariagio granorum ab orriis decimal' usque monasterium hoc anno, 26s. 2d. Et sol. tenentibus de Shynkley pro cariagio 24 plaustr. carbonum hoc anno ad 5d., 12s. Et in 18 plaustr. carbonum empt. apud Branndonmor et Kymyls∣worth, una cum cariagio ejusdem usque monasterium et Beaurpark hoc anno, 23s. 4d. Et in 31 di. dd. carbonum empt. et cariat. per equos a puteis de Branndonmor et Barrewslonyng ad 12d., 31s. 6d. Et sol. Will'mo Gamylsby, Thome Spragyn, Joh'i Dychaund, Cuthberto
Martyne et Thome Stubes pro cariagio 300 4xx 7 di. dd. carbonum a puteo de Brome ad 6d., 41li. 3s. 9d. Et sol. diversis operariis operantibus pro perimplecione plaustro∣rum fimo hoc anno, 2s. Et sol. tenentibus de Esshe et Ewshow pro cariagia (sic) fimi usque le Qwynneclosse, 7s. 6d. Et sol. Americo Daunde, Relicte Adthe, et tenentibus de Esshe, arand. in le Qwynneclosse hoc anno, 11s. 5d. Et sol. messoribus siliginis et aven. in le Qwynnyclosse, 12s. Et sol. Thome Holborne et socio pro trituracione unius quarterii siliginis ad 4d., 2s. 8d., et 9 quar. aven. ad 2d., 18d., 4s. 2d. Et puellis de Beaurp'k pro ventulacione dictorum granorum hoc anno, 8d. Et in expensis factis circa colleccionem decimarum villarum de Weston, Harton, et Southwyk hoc anno, 36s. 8d. Et sol. per capellanum de Shellez pro trituracione 8 quar. frumenti ad 4d., 2s. 8d., 14 di. qar ordii ad 3d., 3s. 7d. ob., 7 di. qar pis. et fab. ad 2d., 15d., et 3 di. qar aven. ad 2d., 7d. provenienc. de dec. villar. de Westow et Shellehough hoc anno, 9s. 1d. ob. Et puellis ejusdem ville pro ventulacione dictorum granorum, 12d. Et sol. Joh'i Mathow de Fulwell pro trituracione 7 di. qar frumenti ad 4d., 2s. 6d., 6 qar ord. ad 3d., 18d., 2 qar pis. et fab. ad 2d., 4d., et 1 di. qar aven. ad 2d., 3d. ob., provenienc. de decima de Southwyk hoc anno, 4s. 7d. ob. Et pro ventulacione dictorum granorum, 4d. Et in expensis factis in colleccione decime granor. de Northsherburn hoc anno, 4s. Et sol. Roberto Holborne et socio pro trituracione 8 di. qar 1 bus. frumenti et siliginis ad 4d., 2s. 10d. ob., 4 di. qar ord. ad 3d., 13d. ob., 20 di. qar aven. 3s. 5d., et 2 bus. pis. et fab. ad 2d., provenienc. de dec. de Northsherburn hoc anno, 7s. 5d. Et sol. eisdem pro ventulacione 33 qar dictorum granorum ad ob., 16d. ob. Et sol. Thome Chepman et Thome Thorppe pro reparacionibus factis super orria decimalia de Byllyngham, 3s. 9d., et Wolueston, 6s., hoc anno, 9s. 9d. Et in expens. Joh. Harper, Thome Hart, Rad'i Pape, et Joh'is Yngland circa colleccionem una cum cariagio et le Stakkyng decimar. villar. de Byllyngham, 18s., Wolueston Newton, 31s., et Coupon 10s., hoc anno, 59s. Et sol. Thome Chepman pro trituracione 18 qar 2 bus. frumenti ad 4d., 6s. 1d., 1 qar 2 bus. siliginis ad 4d., 5d., 33 di. qar 2 bus. ordii ad 3d., 8s. 5d., 18 qar pis. et fab. ad 2d., 3s., et 10 qar aven. ad 2d., 20d., provenienc. de dec. de Byllyngham hoc anno, 19s. 7d. Et pro ventulacione dictorum granorum ad ob., 3s. 4d. Et sol. Thome Thorpe de Wolueston pro trituracione 29 qar frumenti ad 4d., 9s. 8d., 44 qar ord. ad
3d., 11s., 24 qar pis. et fab. ad 2d., 4s., et 12 qar 2 bus. aven. ad 2d., 2s., provenienc. de decim. vill' de Woleston (sic) et Newton hoc anno, 26s. 8d. Et eidem pro ventulacione 109 qar dictorum granorum ad ob., 4s. Et Joh'i Foster pro trituracione 12 qar frumenti ad 4d., 4s., 13 qar ordii ad 3d., 3s. 3d., 8 qar pis. et fab. ad 2d., 17d. provenienc. de dec. de Coupon hoc anno, 8s. 8d. Et pro ventulacione 32 qar dictorum granorum ad ob., 16d. Et sol. tenentibus de Estmeryngton, Rob'to Edgare et Ric'o Fox de eadem pro cariagio et colleccione decim. ejusdem ville hoc anno, 13s. 6d. Et sol. Ricardo Wille pro trituracione 27 qar frumenti ad 4d., 9s., 10 qar ordii ad 3d., 2s. 6d., 4 bus. pis. 1d. et 22 qar aven. ad 2d., 3s. 8d., pro∣venienc. de decim. de Estmeryngton hoc anno, 15s. 2d. Et eidem pro ventulacione 59 qar dictor. granor. ad ob., 2s. 5d. Et sol. Miloni Rotter pro expens. in collectione et cariagio granor. decim. de Fery super montem hoc anno, 26s. 8d. Et sol. eidem pro trituracione 27 di. qar 2 bus. frumenti ad 4d., 9s. 4d., 4 qar 3 bus. ord. ad 3d., 13d., di. qar 3 bus. pis. et fab. ad 2d., et 42 qar aven. ad 2d., 7s. provenienc. de decim. de Fery super montem, 17s. 6d. Et eidem pro ventulacione 74 di. qar dictor. granor. ad ob., 3s. 1d. Et sol. Xpof. Fenwyk molendin∣ario, pro imposicione 1 payr molarum super molend. de Shellez hoc anno, 3s. 4d.
Summa, 4xx 10li. 2s. 7d. ob.

Reparaciones. Et sol. Symoni Blewmynay et 2bus servientibus operantibus in emendacione foraminum super capellam et cameram d'ni Prioris, cameras in firmar' et dormitor', una cum emendacione et bodomhyng 1 le lede in tenemento Georgii Day de Gatyshed per 5 di. dies per diem 14d., 6s. 5d. Et in 18 di. lib. Sowder empt. de Symone Blewmynay ad 4d., 6s. 2d. Et sol. Roberto Galilee et Rad'o Galilee carpentariis, operantibus in diversis reparacionibus in patria et villa, tam tenementorum quam molendinorum et aliorum necessariorum infra et extra monasterium per 50 septimanas hoc anno ad 3s. 4d., 8li. 6s. 8d. Et sol. eidem Roberto pro 1 serviente operante secum in dolacione meremii in parco de Beaurepark et ad molend. de Scaltok, Burdon, et Acley per 50 dies, per diem 4d., 16s. 8d. Et sol. Thome Hunter operanti ibidem per 9 dies, per diem 3d., 2s. 3d. Et sol. Thome Heryson, carpentario, pro reparacione molendini fullatici de Acley, ex convencione facta in grosso hoc anno, 12s. Et sol. Thome Belle et filio pro serracione 8 rodd. meremii et
bordarum in diversis reparacionibus, tam tenementorum quam molendinorum et aliorum necessariorum per tempus compoti, 2s. 8d., 21s. 4d. Et sol. Thome Hunter, Whelwryght, operanti infra et extra monasterium in factura et reparacione plaustrorum, bigarum, rotarum, et aliorum necessariorum per tempus compoti, 33s. 4d. Et sol. Americo Daund, Will'mo Browne, et tenentibus de Hewshaw, pro cariagio 43 plaustr. le fewell a Beauerpark et Rylley hoc anno ad 9d., 32s. 3d. Et sol. Americo Wylson et Thome Cawsy pro 8 pl. tegularum ad 10d., 6s. 8d. Et in 3 pl. tegular. empt. de Thoma Layfeld et Ric'o Alde de Dunelm. hoc anno ad 14d., 3s. 6d. Et sol. Georgio Skeloss, Thome Causy, et Americo Wilson pro nova tectura 5 roddes et 1 qar super stabulum et coquinam de Pyttyngton, di. rod., molend. de Scaltok, 2 rodes et 1 qar, commune furnum de Elwet, ac super diversa tenementa in ballio boriali, di. rod., et in vico Sci. Egidii, 1 di. rod., hoc anno ad 4s. 6d., 23s. 7d. Et sol. Georgio Skeloss, Joh'i Symson, et Americo Wylson, pro punctuacione 30 rod. super orria fenalia maneriorum de Beuarpark, Pyttyngton, et super tenementa in Ballio Boriali, Elwett, et Gelygatt hoc anno ad 8d., 20s. Et sol. eidem Georgio, Joh'i Symson, Ric'o Alde et sociis, pro diurnitat. in punctuacione, tectura, et emendacione foraminum infra et extra monasterium hoc anno per tempus compoti, 38s. 5d. Et in 12 pl. calcis empt. de Joh'e Davson de Coxhow hoc anno ad 14d., 14s. Et sol. Rob'to Shortt, Joh'i Davson de Coxhow, et tenentibus de Shynklay, pro cariagio 12 pl. dicti calcis usque monasterium, Beaurpark, et diversa tenementa in villa ad 8d., 8s. Et sol. Americo Daund, Willelmo Broune, et tenentibus de Esshe, pro cariagio 11 pl. tegularum a quarreris de Esshe et Brassyd usque molend. de Scaltok et diversa tenementa in villa ad 8d., 7s. 4d. Et sol. Rob'o Shorte, Joh'i Davson, Americo Daunde, et tenentibus de Shynkley, pro cariagio 15 pl. sabuli ad 2d., 2s. 6d., et 8 pl. luti ad 3d., 2s., usque monasterium et alibi in villa et diversa tenementa in villa hoc anno, 4s. 6d. Et sol. Thome Raw et Thome Hunter pro lasseracione Ml Ml asserum ad 3d., 6s. Et sol. Henrico Cromy cum 1 serviente pro situacione 1 brewled in tenemento Xpof. Huchynson in Elwett per 3 dies, per diem 7d., 21d. Et sol. Rolando Heryson pro le pavynng coram fronte Jacobi Garnett ex convencione, in grosso 2s. 6d. Et sol. Joh'i Guby, Henr. Cromy, Joh'i Buk, cum 1 serviente, in muracione et dalbura ac tectura straminea, super diversa tenementa in Sadlergat, Geligat, et Elwett
hoc anno, per 6 dies, per diem inter se 15d., 7s. 6d. Et in virgis (et) dalbyng stowres empt. hoc anno, 4d. Et sol. Cuthberto Wylkynson, Thome Holme, Roberto Olyuer, Joh'i Gresson, Rob'to Heryson, et Lionello Armestrange, operantibus super stagnum molendini et in le mylnerasse de Scaltok hoc anno per 14 dies, per diem 2s., 28s. Et sol. diversis portantibus le mosse ad idem opus, per tall. Joh'is Greneswerde, 4s. Et in 2abus restibus emptis pro le ferybott de Byllyngham hoc anno, 2s. Et sol. pro exasperacione ferramentorum molendinorum de Shellez, 4s., Southwyd (sic), 16d., Pyttyngton, 16d., Rannton, 8d., Byllyngham, 16d., Wolueston, 16d., Newton, 16d., Hesylden, 16d., Acley, 16d., Shelome, 16d., et Burdon 16d., hoc anno, 16s. 8d.
Summa, 24li. 11s. 10d.

Focale. Et sol. Joh'i Stokall pro factura lez (fagottes) Omitted in MS., but here supplied from other rolls. in Bearpark pro expensis domus per tempus compoti, 20s. Et sol. Joh'i Davson et 4or sociis pro expensis factis in campo de Aldyngraunge circa penetracionem puteorum et auriend. carbonum pro expens. domus per idem tempus, 7li. 10d. Et sol. Joh'i Davson pro factura et emendacione scoparum hoc anno, 8d. Et sol. Thome Robynson de Dunelm. pro exasperacione le pyckes hoc anno, 12d. Et in 1 reste empta de Thoma Heghyngton pro puteo hoc anno, 12d.
Summa, 8li. 3s. 6d.

Soulsylver. Et sol. forestariis de Mugleswyk et Beaurpark pro eorum soulsylver per tempus compoti, viz. per 50 septimanas, capientibus per septimanam 4d. ob., 37s. 6d. Et sol. Cuthberto Pape, carter valect. pro suo soulsylver ex convencione in grosso, 20s. Et sol. viginti servientibus infra abbathiam in diebus piscium pro eorum soulsylver per totum annum extra quadragesimam, 4li. 18s. 10d. ob.
Summa, 7li. 16s. 4d. ob.

Pensiones. Et sol. Suppriori pro pensione sua, 40s. Et sol. Archidiacono de Estrydyng, 53s. 4d. Et sol. 4or Cantaristis in ecclesia, cuilibet eorum 40s., 8li. Et sol. (blank). Et sol. magistro Infirmarie pro pensione sua, 26s. 8d. Et sol. refectorario, 6s. 8d. Et sol. granatorio, 16s. 8d. Et sol. capellano de Derlyngton, 53s. 4d. Et sol. capellano de Dedynsall, 53s. 4d. Et sol. capellanis de Heryngton et Hauerton, 9li. 6s. 8d. Et sol. capellano de
Mugleswyk, 26s. 8d. Et sol. doctori Kellet, jurisperito, Thome Tempest, Rob'to Mynnell, et Thome Farefax, legisperitis, 5li. Et sol. Joh'i Brymlay, Afterwards master of the choristers and organist. In one of the old MS. books of the Cathedral is a Kyric composed by him. He died in 1576, and lies in the Galilee. Rites, ch. xxii. cantori, 4li. Et sol. Thome Newell, senescallo Prioratus Dunelm., 100s. Et sol. Thome Tempest, clerico Scaccarii et libere Curie ac attornato d'ni Prioris Dunelm., 6li. 13s. 4d. Et sol. rectori de Ballio Australi, 15s. Et sol. magistro de Farne, 4li. 3s. 4d. Et sol. Leonello Elmeden, m'shall, 40s. Et sol. Thome Whythed, kyrvor, 20s. Rogero Claxton, sewer, 13s. 8d., et Philippo Gower, cupberer, 46s. 8d. Et sol. Rob'to Whitehed, valecto cellarii vini d'ni Prioris, Lionello Smyth, valecto Usher, Rob'to Thomson, valecto coco, Rob'to Adthe, janitori abbathie, Rob'to Werdale, scribe scaccarii, et Nich'o Newsham, valecto parve domus, "Domus bursarie," 1511-12. cuilibet 20s., 6li. Et sol. Ric'o Todd, valecto stabuli d'ni Prioris, Jasper Horsley, cursori scaccarii, et Nicholao Browne, barbitonsori, cuilibet eorum 26s. 8d., 4li. Et sol. Nich'o Huchynson, valecto promptuarii, "Popinario," 1511-12. Joh'i Capper, valecto refectorii, W'o Dalton, gromo camere, Joh'i Brak, gromo stabuli d'ni Prioris, Will'o Gamylsby, gromo bursarii, Thome Spragen, custodi granarii, Jacobo Foster, palaser de Beaurpark, Clementi Hall, et W'o Heryson, plaustrariis ejusdem, ac Gavino Trotter forestario de Acley, cuilibet eorum 13s. 4d., 6li. 13s. 4d. Et sol. Rob. Atchet, custodi cervisie nostro celler', 11s. 8d. Et sol. Matheo Spark, pistori, W'o Gamylle, pandoxatori, M'o Blaxton, ballivo de Byllyngham, Cuthberto Pape, Thome Yngland, Nich'o Pykeryng, Three men are here described as "veredarii" in 1511-12. et Americo Daund, custodi animalium apud Rylley, cuilibet eorum 20s., 7li. Et sol. magistro Tempest, forestario de Beawrpark, Georgio Conȝers, clerico capelle, Rob. Smyth, gromo aule, Will'mo Thomson, gromo promptuarii, Jacobo Robynson, gromo coco, Hugoni Trewhit, Thome Hogeson, gromis pandoxa∣torii, Joh'i Dychand, molendinario, Edwardo Trewhit, fyerman, Henrico Blunt, fabro, cuilibet eorum 10s., 100s. Et sol. Matheo Symson, bagman, Joh'i Paxton, Joh'i Wilȝamson, brasiatoribus, et Joh'i Newton, waneman, cuilibet 12s., 48s. Et sol. Rob'to Syme, catori (pro) senescallo d'ni Prioris, M'maduco Wermoth, clerico Infirmarie, Joh'i Walker, et W'o Taylȝor, Tho. Rawe, cowper, lotrici de le napre d'ni Prioris, et custodi de
Westow, cuilibet eorum 6s. 8d., 46s. 8d. Et sol. Joh'i Hunter, ortulano d'ni Prioris, Thome Whitefeld, et Ric'o Wylle, forestariis de Mugleswyk et Hanyng, cuilibet eorum, 5s., 15s. Et sol. Edw. Patonson, custodi claustri, lotrici de le napre in refectorio, utrique eorum 3s. 4d., 6s. 8d. Et sol. Symoni Blewmynay, plumber, 40s.
Summa, 100li. 3s.
Stipendia ex nova. Et in pensione et stipendio ex imposicione magistri Thome Castell, nuper Prioris, in augmentis et sustentacione famulorum prescriptorum pro supplemento eorum reparalium et aliorum.

Et sol. Leonello Elmeden, M'shall, 23s. 4d. Et sol. Thome Whitehed, kyrvor, 31s. 8d. Et sol. Rogero Claxton, sewer, 25s. Et sol. Philippo Gower, cuppeberer, 25s. Et sol. Georgio Conȝers, clerico capelle, 3s. 4d. Et sol. Rob'to Whithed, valecto cell. vini, 6s. 8d. Et sol. M'o Huchynson, valecto promptuarii, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Ric'o Todd, valecto stabuli, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Lionello Smyth, valecto usher, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Rob. Thomson, valecto coco, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Will. Dalton, gromo camere d'ni Prioris, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Joh'i Brak, gromo stabuli, 6s. 8d. Et sol. Will. Thomson, gromo promptuarii, 3s. 4d. Et sol. Rob'to Smyth, gromo aule, 3s. 4d. Et Rob'to Syme, catori Senescalli, 3s. 4d. Et sol. Jacobo Robynson, gromo coco, 3s. 4d. Et sol. Jacobo Dukett, capellano cantarie beate Marie in capella Sce. Margarete, 40s. Et sol. cantaristis Roberti Rodd' et Agnetis Rodd', cuilibet celibranti per mensem, 5s. 4d.
Summa, 13li. 12s. 4d.

Resolucio pro terr. ad firm. affirmat. Et sol. Elemosinar. Dunelm. pro firma de Northrylley, 53s. 4d. Et sol. eidem pro firma unius claus. voc. Holcrofte, 60s. Et sol. Rob'to Elstob pro terr. et ten. in Estmeryngton, 12s.
Summa, 6li. 5s. 4d.

Redditus Resolutus. Et sol. d'no Ep'o pro firma fixionis stagni molendini fullatici de Acley, 12d. Et eidem pro landmale in burgo Dunelm., 15d. ob. Et sol. eidem pro sectis curie ibidem omnium terrarum pertinen∣tium monasterio Dunelm., 8d. Et eidem pro landmale 1 tenementi nuper Joh'is Mathow in foro Dunelm., 12d. Et sol. Rob'to Millett pro libero redditu cujusdam tenementi, 2s. Et eidem d'no Ep'o pro landmale 4or burgagiorum in Sadlergate cum 12d. solut. pro uno orto, 22d. ob. Et eidem pro landmale unius tenementi
nuper Will'i Fenwyk, 12d. Et pro landmale, 20d., et sectis curie in Sunderland, 8d., 2s. 4d. Et eidem pro landmale et sectis curie in Gatyshed, 22d. ob. Et sol. pro Wodyron (sic) "Wodhire," 1511-12; sometimes "Vodhir" appears. in Aldyngryge et Rylley, 3d. ob. Et eidem pro finis (sic) et sectis curie in Aluerton, 6d. Et eidem d'no Ep'o pro sectis curie in Hartylpolle, 8d., landmale, 18d., ac pro 1 domo ibidem, 12d., 3s. 2d. Et Priori de Fynchall pro libero redditu manerii de Aldyngryg, 3 toftis, et 50 acr. terre quondam Rogeri Cowhird, 2 messuagiis 10 acr. terre in Brome quondam Joh'is Cowhird, 3s. 8d. ob. Et sol. Sacriste Dunelm. pro 3 acr. prati in Bellacis, 7d. Et sol. eidem pro terr. in Wolueston nuper rec. ab officio Bursarii ac superius oneratis, 25s. 6d. Et sol. eidem pro terris in Estmeryng∣ton nuper assignatis ut supra, 73s. 4d. Et eidem pro lumine beate Marie in ecclesia Dunelm., 13s. 4d. Et eidem pro libera firma in Sadlergate, 5s. Et sol. Elemos. Dunelm. pro Ferthingcroft in Southstrett, 14d. Et eidem pro libero redditu in Estrannton, 20s. Et sol. com∣muniario Dunelm. pro libero redditu in Wolueston, 26s. 6d. Et eidem pro quodam annuo redditu exeunte de 2bus tenementis in Estmeryngton, 36s. 8d. Et eidem pro quodam annuo redditu exeunte de uno tenemento in Westrannton, 24s. 6d. Et eidem pro terr. in Wolueston nuper rec. ab officio communiarii et assignat. officio Bursarii ac superius onerat., 72s. 2d. Et eidem pro terr. in Byllyngham nuper assignat. et onerat. ut supra, 26s. 8d. Et eidem pro terr. in Fery super montem assignat. et onerat. ut supra, 24s. Et eidem pro terr. in Moreslay assignat. ut supra, 16s. 8d. Et eidem pro terr. in Mounketon assignat. ut supra, 24s. 2d. Et eidem pro terr. in Hebbarne assignat. ut supra, 40s. Et eidem pro terr. in Symondsyd assignat. ut supra, 4li. 8s. 10d. Et sol. eidem pro terr. in Burdon nuper assignat. et onerat. ut supra, 10s. Et sol. Procuratori beate Marie in Jarrow pro terr. in Hebbarne nuper assignat. officio Bursarii, 16d. Et sol. Priori de Kyrkham pro quadam annua pensione soluta ad festum Purificacionis Beate Marie, 4s. Et sol. magistro de Kepeyere pro libero redditu omnium terrarum et tenementorum in Gelygat, una cum 11s. 8d. de libero (redditu) omnium terrarum et tenementorum que fuerunt Thome Lumley, capellani, ac cum 2s. 8d. de libero redditu unius tenementi quondam Thome Ryall, cum sect. cur., et 4d. de libero redditu
unius silionis nuper Roberti Marshall, 54s. 3d. ob. Et sol. capellano cantarie beate Marie in ecclesia Sci. Nicholai pro libero redditu 1 tenementi in Fleshergate, nuper Will'i Fenwyk, capellani, 5s. Et sol. Roberto Aclome pro libero redditu in Brome, 13s. 4d. Et sol. magistro Galilee, 6s. 8d. Et procuratori capelle Sci. Nicholai in Fery super montem pro 8 acr. terre in territorio, 10s.
Summa, 31li. 18s. 5d.

Contribuciones. Et in denariis solutis d'no Ep'o Romam (sic, or, Romani) pro denar. Sci. Petri de terminis Pentecostes et Martini infra tempus compoti, 7s. Et in uno subsidio soluto d'no Regi pro decima hoc anno, 4li.
Summa, 4li. 7s.

Allocaciones. Et petit alloc. de denariis dupliciter oneratis infra liberam firmam terr. et ten. quondam Thome Fery in Fery, eo quod onerantur infra liberam firmam ejusdem ville, ac infra summam de 53s. 4d. onerat. de eisdem terris et tenementis, 6s. 8d. Et in denariis solutis Rectori de Mugleswyk pro liberatura frumenti sui in precio 2 qr. ad 6s. 8d., 13s. 4d. Et in denariis solutis ballivo de Byllyng∣ham pro liberatura frumenti sui in precio 3 qr. 2 bus. ad 5s. 4d., 17s. 4d. Et in den. sol. Gavino Trotter, forestario de Acley, pro lib. fru. sui in prec. 4 qr. 2 bus. ad 5s. 3d., 22s. 8d. Et in den. sol. capellano celebranti in capella de Heworth, ex concessione d'ni Prioris, 13s. 4d. Et in allocacione facta in precio 2 qr. 4 bus. de Hauermaltes de Byllyngham, debit. de tenura quondam Will'mi Bennett, eo quod conceduntur eidem cum tenement. ad 4s., 10s. Et petit alloc. de diversis pratis super Gelylez, Pellowlez, lucratis et inductis ad usum domus, sic inferius oneratis, 8li. 11s. 4d. Et in den. sol. ballivo de Shellez pro feodo suo, ac cum una roba, 40s. Et in denar. sol. infra villam de Byllyngham pro quadam parcella terre vocata Frognell, supra onerata ad 60s. eo quod in manu d'ni pro equis carect., preter 24s. pro parcellis inde venditis tenentibus ibidem, 36s. Et in 4or vaccis liberatis fratribus et sororibus hospitalis de Wytton, 26s. 8d. Et in denariis solutis scribenti hunc compotum, 6s. 8d. Et petit alloc. de 4or qr. 6 bus. de Colthauer, eo quod expenduntur cum equis carect. et curie, sic inferius oneratis, 5s. 7d. ob. Et pet. alloc. de den. sol. Hostillario Dunelm. pro libera firma unius tenementi in Elwet, 4s. 8d. Et pet. alloc. de tot denariis solutis vicario computantis in ecclesia, 13s. 4d. Et pet. alloc. de den. sol. subsacriste pro candelis albis ad missas
privatas tempore Yemali, 20d. Et pet. alloc. de den. sol. capellano de Esyngton, 60s. Et pet. alloc. de den. sol. magistris Euererd et Ranald Beysley, officiariis in Holden∣shyr, pro feodis suis, 60s.
Summa, 25li. 9s. 3d. ob.

Tallia et Indenture. Et in solucione facta d'no Rogero Mydelham, Cellerario Dunelm., pro expensis coquine per tempus compoti, ut patet per Indentur. inter computantem et dictum Cellerarium fact. et huic compoto annex. This indented roll is no longer attached, and has not been found, but the Cellarer's roll for 1438-9, in which the expenses amount to 530li. 2s 3½d., is given in extenso above, pp. 62-77.
Summa, 531li. 14s. 4d. ob.

DIV2.HEAD: Rentale Bursarii, 1539. Printed at the end of the Feodarium edited for the Surtees Society by Canon Greenwell (vol. 58, 1872, p. 302).
c. 1540. A list of rents in arrear.
Comp. Will'i Barry, monachi Dunelm., receptoris denario∣rum proveniencium de minera carbonum apud Raynton (Pur. B.V.M., 1409-19).
DIV2.P: The receipts are given for ten years, and are, 29li. 15s. 6d., 39li. 19s. 1½d., 41li. 12d., 48li. 4s. 1d., 49li. 17s. 9½d., 52li. 18s. 6d., 35li. 18s. 7d., 21li. 9s. 7d., 51li. 2s. 2½d., 34li. 7s. 2½d. Summa totalis, 403li. 13s. 7d. (comes to 403li. 12s. 7d.).
Expenses. Circa lucracionem Aqueductus minere predicte anno undecimo, 33li. 9s. 6d. ob.; Ric'o Hessewell tunc Bursario, 119s. 8d.; Joh'i Neuton, Rectori de Hoghton pro decima carbonum, 66s. 8d.
(Similar entries for each year).

Other expenses are, In lib. facta Marmaduco filio Joh'is Lumley, militis, pro expensis suis faciendis in suscepcione gradus bacular., ex curialitate Prioris, 66s. 8d.; in exp. servientis Elemosinar. versus Oxon. ex precepto dicti Prioris, 5s.; apud Raby super baptizacione filii comitis Westmerl', 11li. (Repairs of Prior's camera, mining tools, silver vessels, tithes, presents, etc.).
Summa omn. exp., soluc., et lib., ccciiijxxxvjli. viijs.
(This roll is faded and indistinct in many places).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni T. N(esbett) receptoris denariorum proveniencia (sic) Proveniencium in other rolls. de minera carbonum duorum puteorum de Fery et de Raynton (Inv. S. Crucis, 1427-8). This and the nine following rolls form a continuous uniform series.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 59li. 13s. 7½d.; Fery, 12li. 15s. 7½d.
Summa, 72li. 9s. 3d.

Exp. In primis in exp. d'ni Prioris apud London pro ecclesia de H., 13li. 6s. 8d. Item in exp. d'ni Pr. in Bapt. fil. comitis Westm., 6li. 13s. 4d.; d'no W. Doncastr. pro pecuniis de eodem mutuatis pro incepcione Will'i Ebchestr., 10li. 6s. 8d.; m'ro T. Ludbery monacho Wygorn, 40s.; uni fratri, medico, de ordine predicatorum, commoranti Ebor., 40s.; m'ro Will'o Norham, fratri ejusdem ordinis, 13s. 4d.; ministris d'ni Ep'i Dunelm. apud Aukland et alibi, 46s. 4d.; Henr. Feryby ad fabricam eccl. Dunelm. 60s.; Joh'i Durham, camerario, causa mutui, 6li. 13s. 4d.; Rectori de Houghton pro decima carbonum de Raynton, 53s. 4d.; Will'o March supervisori puteorum predictorum, 20s.; T. Tesdall commoranti apud Beaurepair, 6s. 8d.; T. Spycer de Eluet diversis vicibus pro medicinis factis, 6s. 8d.; Joh'i de Northfolchia pro 1 eylour et 3 Ryddell' pro Priori, 30s. 8d.; Elemosinario pro waylefe, 6s. 8d.; in elemosina, 5s. 3½d.; Rob'to de Sarterina (?) pro lodic. et factura unius cape et 1 cuculle Priori, 5s.; in exp. d'ni Prioris apud Aukland et Raby divers. vic. 14s. 11d.; in 1 payr sandpokes, 1 trowell, 1 staynax, 2s. 1d.; Joh. Burneby vers. Oxon., 3s. 4d.; Will'o Aldyngshell pro diversis speciebus, 4s. 2d.; pro certis unguentis, ypocras, 1 capa (?) turbyt, servisia, oleo, ovis, et speciebus emptis pro Priore, 12s. 7d.; uni medico hospitanti ad domum Gaynford, venienti apud Beaurepair pro d'no Priore, 3s. 4d.; uni viro portanti ferinam, 20d.; Will'o Mosse ex precepto Pr. 2s.; in exp. T. Ray versus Novocastrum diversis vicibus, et pro 1 cera, 21d.; fil. T. del. Hall ex prec. Pr., 8d.; Joh'i Pekaryng ex prec. d'ni Pr., 3s. 4d.; uni fulloni pro purgacione vestium, 8d.; d'no Joh'i Byrtly, capellano, 4s. 8d.; operariis d'ni Prioris, scilicet Joh'i Bell, Joh'i Uswald, Joh. Fayrher, Will'o Henrison, T. Curwenne, et Will'o Sawer, W. Glasyer, T. Lord, cum ceteris, 9li. 18s. 11d.
Summa omn. exp., 66li. 8s. ob.
(Receipts, 72li. 9s. 3d., but arrears due to Prior of Finchale and others, 15 entries, 7li. 12s. 3½d., so that there is a deficit of 31s.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1428-9.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 37li. 14s.; Fery, 11li. 17s. 5d.

Among the expenses are, Elemosinar. pro Waynleve ad put. de Raynton, 6s. 8d.; homini de Northfolchia pro 1 panno de say et 1 couleclath empt. pro d'no Priore, et
serico empto, 22s. 6d.; Rob. de Sartri pro factura 2 cucullarum pro Priore, et suicione 1 costri pro aula d'ni, et filo, 4s. 6d. ob.; pro 1 mortario et 2 chaufurez, 6s. 7d.; computanti pro supervisione puteorum, ex precepto d'ni Prioris, 26s. 8d.

Dona Prioris. Include, 2bus monachis de Ybernea, 2s.; messoribus de Eluethall, 20d.; Will'o Durham portanti 1 lib. a Stamford, 20d.; in Baptismate fil. Will. Lumley, 3li. 8s. 4d.; Joh. Wessyngton, 3s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1429-30.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 30li. 12s. 4d.; Fery, 3li. 4s. 2½d.

Exp. Include, Elemos. Dunelm. pro Wayleve, 6s. 8d.; pro factura 2 fenestrarum in 2 perlour d'ni Pr., 3s. 5d.; in 1 clave et emendacione 1 cere pro Butria camere d'ni Pr., 6d.; pro 1 petra de Merbyll pro d'no Pr., 20s.; pro 10 Skonsis empt. et lib. Noviciis ex precepto d'ni Pr., 4s. 6d. Joh'i de Northfolch pro 1 pare de Strayles empt. pro d'no Pr., 6s.; in 1 sowreskynne empt. pro d'no Pr., 18d.; pro seminacione glandium infra parcum de Beurepair ex pr. d'ni Pr., 8d.; supervisori puteorum ex precepto d'ni Prioris, 26s. 8d.

Donaciones d'ni Prioris. Include, famulo Prioris de Fyncall portanti ferinam, 8d.; portanti altilia, 8d.; do. do., 12d.; Subsacriste ad lumen in nocte Nat. D'ni, 6d.; Rob'to de le Sarteryn, 4d.; portanti heronsues, 12d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1430-31.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 20li. 13s. 1½d.; Fery, 10li. 6s. 6d.
Var. Rec. De Joh. Ness (?) pistore pro croppys sibi venditis hoc anno, 6s. 8d.
Expens. Include, Waylefe, 6s. 8d.; Will'o Chaloner pro 2 Bannkqweres, 10s. 8d.; Ric'o Wright pro factura Almarialorum in Butria d'ni Pr., 2s. 7d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1431-2.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 26li. 18s. 6d.; Fery, 15li. 12s. 9½d.

Expens. Include, Super facturam novarum camera∣rum d'ni Prioris (52 weeks, masons, building materials, carpenters, etc.). Et in stipendio Joh'is Power kervour,
operantis ibidem per 19 sept. ad diversa precia super le Sylyng de le Parlour et Camere d'ni Prioris, 37s. (carriage of timber, sawyers, plumbers, le parchetyng et blaunchyng, pro posicione arearum lutearum, lime, sharpening tools, tithe to rector of Houghton, to almoner for Wayleve, etc.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1432-3.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 27li. 6s. 2d.; Fery, 11li. 10s. 10½d.

Exp. Relate chiefly to work at the Camera Prioris during the year. Include, Will'o Plumer operanti super facturam unius gargole ac super emendacionem tecture plumbie super cameras d'ni Prioris infra tempus compoti, 12s. 2d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1433-4.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 25li. 3s. 8d.; Fery, 8li. 19s. 3½d.

Expens. d'ni Prioris. Similar account to the last. Include, in stipend. Rob'ti Wrygh(t) operantis super facturam almoriolorum infra capellam d'ni Prioris per 16 sept. ad 20d., minus in toto per 1d., 26s. 7d.; pro 2 birnyngirens, 2s.; Will'o Glasyer operanti super facturam de le Bayewyndowe, 6s. 4d.; pro factura unius shaft infra campum de Heworth pro carbonibus ibidem lucrandis, 20s.; pro 1 pare precarum de auro empt. de Henr. Forster, 8li. 3s. 4d.; pro pergameno, scriptura, et araiacione hujus compoti, 16d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1434-5.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 10s. 8d. ultra expens. in lucracione unius aqueductus; Fery, 10li. 11s. 3½d.

Exp. d'ni Prioris. Include, in stip. Joh. Knayth, latami, operantis super facturam nove porte juxta cameram d'ni Prioris per 13 septimanas; (other workmen at same); Rob. Wright pro factura unius nove porte ex conv., 10s.; (sawing, glazing, leading stone, etc.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1435-6.
DIV2.P: Rec. Fery, 11li. 5s. 5d.; Raynton, nichil.

Exp. d'ni Prioris. Include, in stip. Joh. Caleys carpent. operantis super facturam carpentr. de le yathous per tres sept., 7s. 1d. Will'o Plumer pro tectura plumb. apud novam portam, una cum factura unius gargoll ibidem, 10s. 8d.; pro plumbo empto pro tectura nove porte, 8li.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1436-7.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 14li. 7s. 8d., ultra 11li. 19s. 9½d. sol. pro lucracione unius aqueductus ad eandem mineram; Fery, 27s., et non plus ultra costag. ibidem fact.
Exp. Include, Joh'i Knayth, Mason, operanti ad limitacionem d'ni Prioris per 12 sept. (to others labouring "ex consimili limitacione" and "ad limitacionem d'ni Prioris").

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'nor. Joh'is Barlay et Roberti Westmerlande, 1441-2.
DIV2.P: Vendic. Carbon. Raynton, 40li. 3s. 6d.; Fery, nichil.
Exp. nec. Include, Gliders, hausynges, sholez (and other things, names illegible) apud mineram de Raynton. (Sinking of new pits); alloc. supervisori minere de Rayn∣ton pro le lake et waste, 4li.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. eorundem, de Raynton et Aldyngrige, 1442-3.
DIV2.P: Vend. carb. Raynton, 27li. 15s. 5½d.; Aldyngrige, 11li. 5s. 7d. ultra 10li. 2s. 6d. in precio 230 celdr. carbonum liberat. pro expensis domus, prec. celdre, 9d.
Summa, 39li. 12d. ob.
Exp. Include, pro custodia equicii d'ni Pr., 20s.; pro liberatura supervisoris minere de Aldingrige, 7s. 6d.; Elemos. Dunelm. pro licencia vie apud Moorehouse, 6s. 8d.
Alloc. Mention of "Sholez, Gliders, et pro le lake et waste."

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. eorundem, de eisdem, Inv. S. Crucis ad 6 Dec., 1443.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 12li. 12d.; Aldyngrige, 10li. 1d., ultra carb. liberat. pro expens. domus.
Soluciones denar. Aqueduct at Aldyngrige, cum sinctacione quinque novorum puteorum ibidem, 67s. 7d.

Exonerac. Et in allocacione facta Bertramo Gaythirde pro fodicione et sinctacione unius novi putei apud Raynton, 4li. 8d. Item alloc. eidem pro operariis laborantibus in aqueductu et le dright, cum thirlyng unius shafte, ut patet per bill. 10li. Item alloc. eidem pro cervisia empt. pro operariis, una cum scopez et pykkez, ac 2 cordis emptis pro dicto opere, 47s. 10d.
Summa, 16li. 8s. 6d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ut supra, 5 Dec., 1443, ad Inv. S. Crucis, 1444.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 12li. 4d.; Aldingrige, 106s. 9d. ultra expens. domus.
Soluciones. Include, Mag'ro Will'o Ebchestre pro armis Th. Langley depictis in diversis libris, 8d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Joh. Gatesheued et Rob. Westmerland, 1444-5.
DIV2.P: (Raynton and Aldyngrige. Much decayed).
Rec. (Illegible).

DIV2.HEAD: (Comp.—) Decayed here. This roll contains the usual entries. Joh'is Gatesheuede, 1451-2.
DIV2.P: Rec. Raynton, 32li. 5s. 3½d.; Fery (illegible).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1452-3. (Aldyngrige).
DIV2.P: Item computat in diversis instrumentis emptis per Will'm Herynger pro carbonibus lucrandis ibidem hoc anno, 11s. 4d. Et in expensis per Will'm Herynger factis in sincacione trium puteorum, et scrutacione facta pro carbonibus inveniendis in Spenyngmour, 21s. 4d.

HEADNOTE.P: The Treasurers' books, e.g., that of 1569-70, begin with the annual and other payments to the Dean, the twelve prebendaries, twelve minor canons, readers of Gospel and Epistle (not necessarily minor canons), ten lay clerks, master of choristers, ten choristers, eight poor men, subdean, treasurer, sacrist, precentor, two vergers, two bellringers, head master of school, second master, eighteen scholars, three annuitants, receiver, outer porter, inner porter, two bakers, two cooks, forester of Bearpark, park-keeper of same, bailiff of Shields, keeper of Baxter wood, bailiff of Elvet, keeper of Haning wood, registrar, clerk of the works, bailiffs of Framwellgate and of Billingham, three travelling bailiffs, bailiff of Shores∣wood, repairer of glass windows, vicars of St. Oswald's, Durham, Norham, and Bywell Peter, curate of St. Margaret's, Durham, vicar of Berwick, chaplain of St. Mary's chantry in church of St. Nicholas, Durham, rector of South Bailey, chaplain of Hilton in Wakerfield, rector of Muggleswick, chaplains of Heworth, of Ferry, of chantry of St. James in church of St. Nicholas, of St. Mary in St. Margaret's, of St. Mary in St. Nicholas', of the Holy Trinity in the same, of St. Mary Magdalene, of St. Mary in St. Oswald's, the guild of St. Cuthbert, rents, viz. for aqueduct, in Gilesgate, a tenement, landmale to the bishop for waste at Framwellgate, the Queen for proceeds of above chantries.
The following notes are mostly from the "necessary expenses" and the "Repairs of the Church."

DIV2.P:
Sol. Joh'i Browne, verger, pro locione lintheaminum infra ecclesiam, 2s. Item payd to Mychaell Tomson 20 Decembr. for makyng the yronwark to ye cayse of the
Sacrament at the hye alter, 8s. 6d. Payde for caryage of 11 sekkes Reyshez frome ye Holme wth 4 horsez, 2s., and cuttinge, 12d., 3s. For scowrynge ye paschall (ad festum Pasche tantum), Interlined. and scourynge the gowters about the church by yere. Item pd to Richarde Sheyle in rewayrde for brynginge 2 dooes to ye prebendaryes by th'andes of Mr Doctor Tode, 4to Marcii, 3s. 4d.

Et Ro Sheyle deti (deferenti?) 1 evyll buk erga sessiones 8o Augusti per doctorem Tode in regardis, 3s. 4d. Et eidem die 2obus famulis Judicum debus 1 buk prebendariis et di buke canonicis minoribus et aliis ministris chori in regardis per doctorem Tode, 3s. 4d.

Et 26to Marcii, Will. Newton pro horrilogio ex consue∣tudine per annum, 2s. Pro sarracione 4 waynscott et aliorum meremii (sic) pro operibus in vestibulo et circa le sepulcre (per diem 8d.), 4s. 8d. Pro factura 1 Redorsse de waynscott ad altare in revestiario, 10s.; for glew 5d., and nayls 3d. to ye same worke, 8d. Pro cariagio 3 plaustratorum fyerwood usque plumerhoushe, 2s., bryt∣nynge, 6d.; pro le brytnynge 3 fother et fellynge, 8d. In factura unius hostii pro le lavers, 8d. Et 5to Aprilis sol. for 1 rope scilicet 20ti fawdome for ye pascall, 6s. 8d., and for 40ti fawdome smaller Rope for Gyderopez scilicet 2 fawdome for a peny, 20d., 8s. 4d. Payd to Jaymes Plomer, Willelmo Walker, et Thome Lawes settyng up ye paschall and takyng downe the same, 6s. 8d.
Carpentario (etc.) super le brochet (8d. per diem). For dyvers yron stuff about the sacrament (etc.), 20s. For 1 pollyrope for the brasse pollye, scilicet 2 fawdome, 10d.
(Wax, wine, Hosts, washing of linens).
Et 21 Marcii sol. Petro Hyll, stacyoner, pro 7 psalteriis, 7s., et 1 processionero, 2s. 8d., 9s. 8d.
(Repairs at tenements, mills, aqueduct).
Et 9o Julii sol. 16 mulieribus portantibus mosse and clay per billam ad idem opus, ut patet, 13s. 2d.
Expenses about burnynge a lyme kyll at Kellow 29 Junii, ao 1558vo.

(Gettynge stones to the lyme kyll, dygthynge ye kyll, fyllynge the kyll, one that brake the stones, 7 fother of colles, tenaundes of Hett for caryage (from Hett) to Kellow at 10d., for burnynge a lyme kyll at Kellow).
(Various articles).

Fyve bagges for money, 13d.; 3 quatern. papiri, 12d.; nedyles and thred, 2d.; broddes at 10d. a hundred; for amendynge 1 payr bandes to ye orgayns, 8d.; latbroddes at 5d.; hardyne pro le condeth; lednayle at 5d.; burdnayle at 8d.; broddes at 5d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1563-4. So dated in modern figures. An imperfect book, ill kept, and not appearing to be of much interest.
1564-5. (Frequent repairs of aqueduct).
DIV2.P: Sol. pro emendatione fenestre infra ecclesiam vocatu' (sic) Te Deum Wyndowe, 3li. 6s. Pro emendatione le shavinghowse, 6s. 9d. For fyllinge the holes in the colledge garthe that was mayd for mendinge ye condythe, 4d.
(Repairs of tenements and mills).
Elemos. pro pauperibus et viis emend. (6s. 8d., 3s. 4d., 5s., 10s., 20s., etc., are sums given).

DIV2.HEAD: Between 1565-6 and 1567-8. Imperfect. So dated in modern figures.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the lanteronn of the petycanons kytching (etc.), 27s. 4d. For a salter, 16d. For settinge vp the funte in the colledge churche, 3s. 6d. For fyve poundes of soulder for the condeth and for dyginge and openinge the hearth (earth) in sex severall places, 3s. 4d. For 1 dosen of cooles for the Shayvinge howse, 2s.
(Tenements, mills, and alms as before).

For six quere of paper to make bookes for the singing men, 2s. For makeinge the coveringe of the pulpitcloth to Farro, 2s. 6d. For makeinge the checker over the gatehowse, 30s. For makeing of the partition in the checker, 37s. 8d. To 3 masons that cam to worke upon the bridge that shall be made, 12s. (windows of checker).

For coveringe the benches in the chapter howse and the checker, 3li. 15s. 3d. For Jewelles apologie, 10s. 6d. For sarking of the inner howse in the dorture, 7s. 9d. For tow spalters to the quere and delivered to Pentland and Matthue, Minor canons. Matthew was sacrist. 2s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1569-70. For a communyon table, 30s. 2d.
DIV2.P: This book has as a cover three leaves and part of a leaf that have belonged to some ascetical work, and one leaf of a consuetudinary. The following headings occur: Qualiter estatis tempore agatur nocturna laus. x. Qualiter diebus dominicis vigilie aguntur. xj. Quomodo matutinorum sollempnitas agatur. xij. Qualiter privatis diebus matutini agantur. xiij.
Date of MS. c. 1325. It contains nothing specially local, but is shown to be monastic by its referring to four lections in a nocturn.

DIV2.HEAD: 1570-1. For 2 communion cuppes, 11li. 6d. For mend∣inge a sink at the Lavers, 7s. 8d.

DIV2.P: For mendinge ye stoorhouse dors in ye cloyster and for nayles, 2s. 6d. For mattinge ye com'on (?) pue, 2s. 8d. For candels and wyne to ye communion, 6s. For rushes and flowers at ye Judges being here Aug. 13, 4s. Payd unto Jhon Browne for mending and tunyng (?) ye Chyme, 6li. 13s. 4d. Geven unto Browne ye barber to buy hym cols, 2s.

Nothing remarkable except alms to prisoners, to a poore man that had his house burnde, 3s. 4d., to a scoller of the grammar schole at his goinge to London, 10s., to a scoller of Cambridge for exibition, 40s.; geven to the earle of Lecesters players, 26s. 8d., etc.

Recepta de ecclesiis. Recepta de ecclesiis de annis 1293 (1466li. 16s. 4d.), 1348, scil. 2 annis post bellum Dunelm. et 1 anno ante pestilenciam magnam (1616li. 8s.), 1350, sc. primo anno post pestilenciam magnam (410li. 16s. 8d. ob.), 1392 (452li.), 1420 (396li. 12s.) Et sic rec. de anno 1293 excedunt rec. de 1420 in 1070li. 4s. 4d.

Churches in Scotland named are, Erceldoune, Eder∣ham, and Edyngham, and the priorate of Coldingham. In England, Norham, Holy Island, Ellyngham, Jarow, Heighyngton, Acley, Pittyngton, Hesilden, Meryngton, Byllyngham, Aluerton, Estryngton, and the sums received from the English parishes are given separately under each year, while those from Scotland are lumped together. "Iste rotulus registratus in fine 2i Registri."

HEAD.HI: Expense diverse facte per d'nm Priorem a festo Sci. Martini in yeme 1356 ad Pent. 1357.

DIV2.P:
In primis in elemosina et largicione pauperum per tempus antedictum, 63s. 4d. Item magistro Will'o de Farnham pro pensione sua de termino Pent. 1356 preter solitam pensionem 40s., 13s. 4d.; eidem pro term. Mart. '56, 13s. 4d.; d'no Will'o de Emeldon pro literis missis ad curiam Romanam de London, 3s. 4d.; pro equo albo sacriste misso uxori d'ni Thome de Seton pro exennio, et pro uno freno pro eodem equo, 4li. 14d.; diversis famulis suis ex curialitate, 11s. 9d.; cuidam Xpoforo conducendo pro negociis domus apud Dunelm. trina vice existenti in subsidium laboris sui, 8s. 2d.; diversis ministrallis, 5s. 4d.; pro cathenis, chapes, una leses, et uno cornu ad usum venatoris Prioris, 7s. 11d.; pro silva mundata in le Swynhirst in parco de Beaurepare, 10s. 7d.; nuncio d'ni Arch'i venienti de curia Romana cum literis, preter di. marcam quam solvit Bursarius, 3s. 4d.; pro 4 hatchettes et uno bill ad silvam cedendam in parco de Beaurep',
3s. 8d.; pro funeracione Thome Fole, This and some other entries here made will be found also in the Bursar's roll of 1356-7 under Exp. min. et necessariis expensis ejusdem, 2s. 7d.; pro diversis speciebus ad usum Prioris, 2s. 7d.; pro uniyon sede et allio in orto seminando, 12d.; pro uncto et entracto (?) ad equos Prioris, 9d.; Will'o de Langton defferenti literas a curia Romana, 6s. 8d.; pro uno jumento ad cariand. lapides pro muro in parco de Beaurep', 15s.; diversis famulis per maneria, carpent., et aliis operariis ad potum, 3s. 9d.; pro uno panno nigro pro cucull. ad usum Prioris, 12s.; pro caligis ad usum Prioris, 2s. 3d.; pro duobus paribus botarum, 6s. 6d.; pro sepis empt. ad usum Prioris, 8d.; pro uno pari caligarum dato Thome clerico d'ni Thome de Seton, 18d.; pro suicione veterum tunicarum et fururarum et uncto pro botis Prioris, 10d.; pro clavis empt. et expens. apud Beaurep', 11d.
Summa, 14li. 2s. 4d.

DIV2.HEAD: 1360-61. A bundle of four small indentures of no special interest.
Comp. d'ni Joh'is Oll de receptis pro debitis infrascriptis solvendis. Of no special interest. Dated in modern figures, "1441."

Cart. Misc. No. 2763. No date. Solut. pro reparaone conductus aque. In primis 2obus plu'barijs pro laboribus suis, vjd. Itm. 2obus operarijs fodientibus, iiijd. Et pro corda, panno hardyn, et cebo pro eodem, vd.
DIV2.P: Summa, xvd.
Hugo Whithead. (1524-48).

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2784. No date. To the two plum'ers for worky'g on day and a half at the condythe, xviijd. (canvas, sowder, labourer). (c. 1540).
No. 2723. 1541. Mar. 3. For j day mendyng of the Coundeithe for byndyng and clothe to ye sayme vjd. and for ij Cth iiijxx and x leade nayle att iiijd. ye Cth, xjd.

DIV2.HEAD: Expenses for reparationes by maister Blakestone (1541-c. 1548).
DIV2.P: Inprimis payd to iiij warkemen for castyng of erthe warke at Wenstone myll, vjs. iijd. Item payd for vj gallons of terre to ye same myll, iijs. vjd. Item for puttyng in of the harm in the ynder wheall, xvjd.
Summa, 11s. 1d.
Item for wasshyng of ye clothes in ye rewestrie, 12d. Item payd for soppe and (rede erased) threde, 16d.
Summa, 2s. 4d.

Item payde Chutbertt Wylkynsone and ij serwantes for mendyng of a chymnay at Johne Helandes tenement on day, 14d. Item payd for wandes and stowres and on futher of claye, 5d. Item payd to Johne Wyllsone plastryng and menyng of a chymna on day wt lyme, 11d. Item payd for nailles and a loke to ye heckedore and j band, 7d. Item payde for ij bandes to ye hal dore and a loke to ye same, 7d. Item payd to Johne Wylsone for mendyng of ye stabyll walle, 4d.
Summa, 4s.

Item payd for rossell to the church, 6d. Item payd for syngyng bredes. Item payd for iiij doussyne and iij poundes of waxe wt ye carregg, 26s. Item payd for on pounde of grene waxe, 8d. Item payd for makyng of ye said waxe, 2s. Item payd for ij futher of lyme wt ye carregg to ye storehousse in Eluett, 4s. Item payd to Wyllam Haere for 4 futher of sand to ye same, 8d. Item payd for ye scowryng of ye pascall, 3s. 4d. Item payd for settyng vpe of ye same, 3s. 4d. Item payd to Wyllam Heytghyngtone for 30 fawdome of roppe for a bell stryng and 7 fawdome of cordes to ye organes, 6s. 8d.
Summa, 48s. 6d.
Summa, 3li. 5s. 11d.

P.HI: Expensses for reparationes by maister Blakestone.

DIV2.P:
Item payde to Robert Marlye for iij dais and halyffe for mendyng of a chymnay at the foster lugge in Bere∣parke, 21d. Item payd to Rayffe Skelus and his man for the same, 5s. Item payd to Robert Rede and George Skerowe wryghtes 7 days and halyff, 3s. 9d. Item payde to Thomas Rede for 4 days, 2s. Item payd for borde
naylles and spykynges, 6d. Item payd to Johne Grene∣swerde and Robert Rechesone for on wekes warke at ye same, 16d. Item payd to Nycoles Browne for on pownd of waxe, 9d. Item payd to Lyelnell Smythe for 67 quartes of vyne to ye chyrch, 11s. 2d. Item payd for ye mendyng of ye ymage of Crist for ye resurrection, 4d.
Summa, 26s. 8d.

Item payd to Wyllam Harmstrang for 2 futher of lyme to the store howsse in the bailyay wt ye carregg, 4s. 4d. Item payd for 2 futher of sande to ye same, 6d. Item payd for 1 futher of lyme and 1 futher of sande wt the carregg to wynkyne Belles tenement in sowghtstrett, 2s. 7d. Item payd to the smyth of chester for 5 hundreth borde naylles, 21d. Item payde for 2 futher of sande to ye storehowsse in ye bailya, 6d. Item payd to Dawsone of Kokesawe for 1 futher of lyme to ye same, 2s. Item payd to Johne Symsone wt 3 serwandes 4 days sklattyng and wallyng at a tenemente in kyngesstrett in ye bailya, 6s. 6d. Item payd for wandes and stowrres and dalbyng to ye same, 2d. Item payd for bord naylles to ye same, 1d. Item payd for castyng ye lyme and sande into the storehowsse, 2d. Item payd for 7 hundreth borde naylles for 2d. ob. a hundreth, 17s. ob. Item payd for 4 spykynges and 2 hundreth borde naylles, 6d. Item payd to Thomas Johnesone for fellyng tymmer in the hye wood for bordes and Jeistes, 12d. Item payd to cuthbert Johnesone wt 2 serwandes for squaryng the same tymmer two dais and a hallyfe, 22d. ob. Item payd to Allane Browne, Nicolle Wylkyngsone, for makyng of 2 clurres, on at Jesus mylles and on at the clokemyll 3 days, 3s. Item payd for naylles and grett spykynges to ye same, 9d. Item payd to Thomas Knagges for makyng of dore stuythes and a horsse bay at a tenement in kynges gatt 4 days and a halyffe, 22d. ob. Item payd to Thomas Knagges for makyng of dores at Lanard Randes tenement in ffyesshergatt, 2s. 2d. ob. Item payd to ye same Thomas for squaryng of a tre for bordes at Bereparke 1 day and a hallyffe. Item payd for on bord to Randes dorres, 1d. Item payd for clengyng of ye wassce howsse in kynges gatt to a laborer, 4d. Item payd for 1 futher sklatt for mendyng 3 tenementes in Sowthstrett, 10d. Item payd for carregg of ye same, 8d. Item payd for 2 futher of sande to the same, 6d. Item payd for castyng in 3 futher of lyme and 3 futher sande in the storehowsse in the bailyay, 2d. Item payd to John Lames wyffe for casting in of 2 futher of lyme and 4 futher
of sande at the storehowsse in Eluett, 2d. Item payd to the tenantes in Cornforth for 4 futher of lyme to the store∣howsse in Eluett, 8s. Item payd for 8 futher of sande to the same howsse, 2s. Item payd to ye same tenantes for 3 futher of lyme to ye storehousse in the bailyay, 6s. Item payd for 3 futher of sande to ye same, 9d. Item payd to Robert Johnesone for castyng in of 4 futher of lyme and 8 futher of sande in to ye storehowsse in Eluett, 3d. Item payd to Johne Farnesone(?) for 3 dd. grett spykyng naylles, 3d. ob. Item payd to ye same Johne for a hundreth brod naylles, 2d. ob. Item payd to the smythe of chester for D brode naylles, 12d.
Summa, 50s. 2d.
Summa totalis, 7li. 2s. 9d.
Verso.

DIV2.HEAD: (Durh. Treasury MS.)
Expenses towardes London the xviijth day of June, Anno Domini 1544to.

ROW.CELL: 1. Inprimis at Duresme for horse shoing of three horse befor my going furth, ijs.; for horsebred, ijs.; iijb. of hauer, xviijd.
Item at Darlington by Gamlesbie, jd.; Aluerton dyner, xd.; horsemete, viijd.; in horsebred, viijd.; watching, ijd. [Supper, etc., at Northallerton or Boroughbridge, 1s. 8d., apparently omitted]
Item the xixth day of June, dyner at Aberforth, xd.; horsemete, xijd.; Dancaster souper, xiijd.; horsemete, xvjd.; in ale, jd.; wyne, iiijd.; a band to the capcase, jd.
The xxth day of June, dyner at Tuxfurthe, xviijd.; horsemete, xijd.; Neward (sic) drynke at nyght, vjd.; wyne, iiijd.; horsemete, xvjd.; watche, ijd.

The xxjth day of June, dyner at Stampford, ijs.; Horsemet, xd.; Huntington at nyght, souper, xijd.; in wyne, iiijd.; in drynk, jd.; in grese for the horses, viijd.; in horsebred and haye, ixd.; for dyghting of my Mrs boites, jd.
The xxijth day of June, dyner at Roiston, xvd.; horsemet, xijd.; Horseshoing, jd.; in wyne, ijd.; souper in Wayre, xviijd.; Horse∣met, xxd.
The xxiijth day of June at Stepney dyner, xxd.; drynk at nyght, xd.
The xxiiijth day of June at London, Boythyer, vijd.; dyner for the seruauntes, viijd.; my dyner, viijd.; souper at nyght, xiiijd.
The xxvth day of June, dyner at Westm., xvjd.; souper at Stepney, xvjd.;

The xxvjth day of June, drynk in the morning, ijd.; for a whery to Westm. and home agayne, vjd.; dyner, xviijd., wyne at dyner, ijd.; souper at Stepney, xvjd., and at p'son belles (Parson Bell's) xijd.
The xxvijth day of June, dyner at London, xvjd.; for a whery, iijd.; drynk at nyght, iiijd.
The xxviijth day of June, dyner at Lon∣don, xvjd.; souper for the seruauntes, viijd.; my souper, viijd.; for a whery, vd.; drynke at nyght, vjd.
The xxixth day of June, dyner, xvjd.; drynk at nyght, vd.; in wyne, ijd.;
The xxxth day of June Gamlesbie dyner at London, vd.; dyner at Westm., xxd.; souper at nyght, xiiijd.; in wyne, ijd.
The furst day of Julie, dyner, xxd.; soper at Stepne, viijd., and at p'son belles, souper, xviijd.
The second day of Julie, dyner, xxd.; souper at Stepne, xvjd.
The iijth day of Julie, dyner, xviijd.; at Stepney souper, xvjd.
The iiijth day of Julie, dyner, xxd.; drynk in the morning, ijd.; drynk at nyght, iiijd.; for a whery, ijd.
The ffifte day of Julie, dyner, xvjd.; drynk at London, viijd.; souper at Stepney, vjd.
The vjth day of Julie, dyner, xxd.; drynk in the morning, jd.; for a whery, iiijd. ob.; souper and wyne, xvjd.; for horsemete, vijs. xd. for all the tyme we in London,
The vijth day of Julie brekfast at Stepney, xvjd.; horsebred, vjd.; in regardes to the maides for wesshing our clothes, xd.
Item the same day dyner at Wayre, xxd.; horsemet, xiijd.; to the smyth, ijd.; to the sadler, ijd.; at Roston souper and wyne, xxd.; horsemet, xviijd.
The viijth day of Julie at Royston for bred and drynk, iiijd.; Huntyngton at dyner, xxd.; horsemet, xijd.; in wyne, iiijd.; Stampford at souper, ijs.; horsemet, xxd.
The ixth day of Julye at Newerke, dyner, xviijd.; wyne, iiijd.; horsemet, xviijd.; horseshoing, ijd.; souper at Tuxforth, xviijd.; in wyne, vd.; horsemete, xxijd.

The xth day of Julie drynk in the morning, iiijd.; dyner at Dancaster, xviijd.; wyne, ijd.; horsemet, xxd.; to the sadler, iijd.; to the smyth, jd.; for horseshoing at Wentbrydge, jd.; at fferybrydge for horsemet, viijd.; for drynk, vjd.; souper in Abberforth, xvjd.; for horsheshoing, ijd.; for horsemet, xviijd.
The xj day of Julie at Boroughbridge for horsemet, xijd.; for drynk, ixd.; Aluerton at dyner, xvjd.; horsemete, xijd.; Darlington souper, xvijd.; wyne, vjd.
The xijth day of Julie, dyner at Darling∣ton, viijd.; Horsemet, xijd.; for mending a sadle, ijd.; horsheshoing, iijd.

Item paid for viij ympnall noted Hymnorum cum notis Opusculum. See Proctor and Wordsworth's edition of the Sarum Breviary, Appendix II, sect. viii. ad xviijd.

Item for xxiiijtie latines The Litany in the English Prayer-book, which was first issued, as a separate publication, in 1544, to be used "in the time of processions." Blunt, Annot. P.B., 1884, 223. wherof j dd. noted with playneson of fyve partes at iijs. the dd.

Item paid to the chaunter of Westmynster for pryking the new Latyny The Litany in the English Prayer-book, which was first issued, as a separate publication, in 1544, to be used "in the time of processions." Blunt, Annot. P.B., 1884, 223. in iij, iiij, and v partes in prykeson
