DIV2.P: (1) Pro ecclesia .3. februarij. In pimis solue'd. Joh'i Brown in parte solucio'is pro factura capar. pro choristis, vjs. viijd. (2) 2o februarij. In pimis 2o die februarij pro xxj dossy'g for maky'g off wax, vijs.
(3) .2. Marcij. In pimis Rob'to Hackett pro hostijs co'secr. 1200, xijd. It' p'ciuillo Elyse for griss to the bellys, ijd. It' pro j buss. off charcoll., ijd. Sa, xvjd.

(4) .15 Aprilis. In pimis for scowry'g off the pascall to Cuthb't paype & hys felowe, ijs. It' for the mand mayd apon mand thirsday at Mr. Deyn com'andeme't, ijs. xd. It' for fower hovndrith breydes to Rot Hackitt, iiijd. S'ma, vs. ijd.

(5) 16o Apilis. Solut. Jacobo Person et Cuthb't Jonson pro croccione This seems to mean scouring with Crocus of iron, a sesquioxide or peroxide obtained by calcination. See N.E.D. Candelabri Paschalis, cum alijs sibi s'uientib' f'ra (feria) 4ta ebdomad' sancte Ao 1545to, iijs. iiijd. S'ma, iijs. iiijd. Hugo Whitehed.

(6) .19. Apilis. In pimis to Cuthb'to Jho'son worky'g on day in the stepyll apon ye bell wheyll, xd. It. for festeny'g ye wyndoo in the Kateron wheyll wt pullys me'dy'g & for strekylles, vd. It. for tynkyll nayll occupyyd apon the bell wheyll, ijd. It. to He'ry Hays . . . for maky'g off the swaype to the cloke & for mendy'g off a loke to Rob't Hackitt, xiiijd. Sa, ijs. vijd.

(7) .15 Apilis. In pimis Joh'e Brovne pro lotioni vestiu' & filo, ijs. iiijd. It. solue'd. eid' for ye last & holl paym't for maky'g copys for ye chorist's & tunykylles, xxs. S'ma, xxijs. iiijd. (8) .16. Apilis. Deliberand. Nichoo Turpy'g pro vino accepto pro celebratio'e missar. a festo natiuitatis d'ni vsq' ad decimu' sextu' die' apilis pro fyfty & sex qartes & for Rot Hackit wagis, xxijs. iiijd. 3o Apilis. (9) pro eccl'ia de bedlygton. In pimis for xxti fout off ymagiry glass, vjs. viijd. It. for fouer & twenty fut off new glass bovght off Jho' chaytr, vijs. It. for workyng off the sayme wt fouer pound of soder, iiijs. iiijd. It. for twyss goyng to belly'gton & caryag off the saym glass, iijs. It. for fyny'g berrys thayr ocupyyd, xxd. It. for mendy'g off brokyn wyndoys in the qeyr thayr two days, xd. S'ma, xxiijs. vjd.
(All except (5) signed per me Robt Dallton).

DIV2.HEAD: In bundle 7119.
DIV2.P: Expens. fact. per dnm Joh'em Brown sacristam a f'o s'ci mich'is Arch. ano d'ni 1547 vsq. ad f'm s'ci Edmu'di regis: also per thomam Elison sacist. a f'o s'ci Edmu'di vsq. ad f'm pasche.
(White candles, mending clock, grease to bells, besoms, brimstone 1d., whip cord).
In cena d'ni post ma'datu'.
In ceruisia vj gall. ad ijd. ob., xvd. In pane, iiijd. In vino clareto, j gall., xijd. In vino rubeo j pottell, viijd. It'm in tackettes to sett vp ye sepulcre, jd.
S'ma, iijs. iiijd. Per me Thoma' Elison.

DIV2.HEAD: In bundle 7119.
DIV2.P: It'm expe's' fact' per thoma' Elison sacist in eccl'ia Dunolm, Ao regni regis Edwardi Sexti secundo (1548-9). Inpimis in waxe this yere, xxviijty at iiijd. a pownd to Jhon Watson of Eluett, ixs. iiijd.

It'm for a bawdryke, xxd. It'm for maykyng of waxe, ijs. It'm for Reshes, xijd. It'm for tallo & busoms, viijd. It'm for a cord to the vayll of thye alt', jd. It'm payd to the churche wardens off lanchest' for xxiiijty pownd off waxe at ijd. the pownd, iiijs.
Summa totalis, xviijs. ixd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2727. n. d., c. 1553.
DIV2.P: For Carryage of ye new grailes and missales. In primis for beryng of theyme frome the shipe to iohn chators howse, iiijd. It. to ye porters for beryng of theym to ye cellar, vjd., and for carryinge of ye saym stuffe over ye brydg, xiiijd. It. to lyonell smythe for carriynge of ye sayme from newcastell to durham, xijd.
Compar. S'ma, iijs. By me iohan tutynge.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2728. n. d.
DIV2.P: Expessu' to Ihc mell. Expensum to "Jesus Mill." The Jesus mills were bought and given to the Church by Prior Castell, to endow the "Jesus mass."—Scriplores tres, 153. first the castyng of ye mell rach xxxj pond & a halff off or awne yt comes ye castyng iij halpens a pond iijs. vjd. & xiiij pond of yr awne & halff yt comes ye castyng to iijs. vjd. ob. S'ma, vijs. ob.
It'm to ye sayme mell laying ye mell spendill Irone & stell & warkman schepe, ijs. vjd. S'ma totalis, ixs. vjd.
It. solut. Jho'i Huntter pro charkoll expe'dyd i' eccl'ia, iiijd.
It. solut. i' aurificio vnius calicis pro mercurio, iiijd.
Compa. S'ma totalis, xs. ijd.
per me Robt. Dallto'.
(Found with the Bursars' Rolls.)

DIV2.HEAD: c. 1553. A Treasurer's Roll, consisting of twelve sheets of paper and a fragment, sewn together in the same way as the membranes in a parchment roll, and having as a watermark a glove and star. The roll is imperfect at the top, and has never contained any account of expenses. The rents of each place are entered in a lump sum. The places are the same as in the Bursars' rolls, but differently arranged. The first series ends thus:—
DIV2.P: Summa omnium Temporalium infra Com. Dunelm. et Al(uerton), 1319li. 11s. 3d.
The next is headed
Comitat. Northumbr.
and ends,
Summa omnium Temporal. infra Comitat.
Northumbr., 31li. 16s. 3d.
Summa omnium Temporal. infra Comitat.
Dunelm. Northumbr. et Al(uerton), 1351li. 7s. 6d.
Spiritualia infra Comitatum Dunelm.

Rector S. Oswaldi, 56li. 10s. 4d. The proceeds of rectories are received in each case "de firmario ibidem."; R. de Jarrow, 29li. 16s. 8d.; R. de Warmouth, 106s. 8d.; R. de Pyttyngton, 26li. 16s. 8d.; R. de Hesilden, 25li. 16s. 8d.; R. de Dalton, 15li. 16s.; R. de Byllyngham, 40li.; R. de Aykeclyff, 22li.; R. de Heghyngton, 35li. 10s.; R. de Meryngton, 26li. 16d.; Pensiones (de diversis pensionibus diversarum ecclesiarum), 6li. 16s. 8d.
Summa omnium Spiritualium infra Comitatum
Dunelm., 200, 4xx, 10li. 11s.
Spiritualia infra Comitatum Northumbr.

Rector de Berwike, (fin. quadrages., nil) 11li.; R. de Norham, 70li. 3s.; R. de Insula Sacra, 21li. 3s. 4d.; R. de Ellyngham, 12li. 13s. 4d.; R. de Edlyngham, 10li. 12s. 8d.; R. de Bedlyngton, 9li.; R. de Bywell, 28li.
Summa omnium Spiritualium infra Comitatum
Northumbr., 163li. 12s. 4d.
Spiritualia infra Com. Ebor.
Rector de Fyshelake, 12li.; R. de Bossall, 24li.; R. de Brauntyngham, 17li.; R. de Aluerton, 20li.
Summa omn. Spiritualium infra Com. Ebor., 73li.
Summa Totalis Recept. cum Arr., 2072li. 2s. 7d.

De quibus allocatur ei de parte Arr. predictorum, viz. anno primo Regis Edwardi Sexti, 12d., anno secundo, 12d., anno 3o, 12d., anno 4to, 3s., anno 5to, 5s., et anno sexto Regis predicti, 12d., ut patet particulariter per Rot. Arr. predictorum, in toto 12s. Et habentur ad manus Joh'nis Totyng, John Towton, B.D., first prebendary in the eighth stall, deprived 1560. prebendarii ac thesaurarii Ecclesie Cath. Dunelm., ut patet per Indentur. fact. inter predictum thesaurarium et predictum receptorem, dat. primo die Octobr. anno regni regis Edwardi sexti sexto, tam de arreragiis quam de exitibus hujus anni, 1757li. 16s. 1d. Et debet 314li. 10s.

Unde in Manu Diversorum Ballivorum Firmariorum Collectorum et aliorum officiariorum, de Arreragiis sive debitis et non solutis ad 16tum die(m) novembris, anno primo Marie Regine, viz. anno 35to Regis Henrici 8, 4li. 13s.; anno 36to, 16li. 6s. 6d. ob.; anno 37o, 15li. 15s. 6d.; anno 38vo Regis predicti, 9li. 14s.; anno primo Regis Edwardi Sexti, 4li. 13s. 1d. ob.; anno 2do, 8li. 18s. 7d.; anno 3o, 12li. 14s. 9d. ob.; anno 4to, 18li. 6s. 9d.; anno quinto, 21li. 9s. 1d., et anno 6to, 47li. 3s. 4d., ut patet particulariter per unum quaternum paupiri Rec. deliberat., ubi nomina et cognomina, cum eorum summis, plenius annotantur et declarantur, 159li. 14s. 8d. ob.

Diversorum Ballivorum Firmariorum Collectorum et aliorum officiariorum de arreragiis suis debitis super determinacione compotorum suorum ad festum Sancti Michaelis Archangeli, anno regni Marie Regine primo, ad predictum 15tum diem Novembr. eodem anno, 154li. 15s. 4d.
Computanti hoc anno, nil.
Et sic quietus est.

DIV2.HEAD: (On a loose slip in the Treasury).
Tercio die Marcii, ano D'ni 1554to (1554-5). The Parliament which sat from Nov. 12, 1554, to Jan. 6, 1554-5, agreed to the reconciliation of the Church of England to the See of Rome.
DIV2.P: Expenses maid the day that the proclamac'on & bonefyres war maid for the Receyving of the Pope in this Realm agayn as folowith.

First Paid for Three potelles of wyn in Doctor Watsons Thomas Watson, D.D., Dean from 1553 to 1557, when he was promoted to be bishop of Lincoln. chamer, xijd. It'm Paid for Two gallons of Ayle dronken in the garthe, vjd. It'm Paid for walnottes bought, iiijd. It'm Paid for on Tarre barrell bought, iiijd. It'm paid for wyn & ayle expend by the seruauntes at nicholas turpyns, iiijs. It'm Paid for two mynstralles, viijd.
Summa, vjs. xd.
Exoneratur per me Wm todd D.D., first prebendary in the fifth stall, deprived before 1567. vicedecanum.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3020.
DIV2.P: The xvth daye of June ao dni 1555.

ROW.CELL: For ledyng of a futher of esshewoode from Howghell hawghe to the Farmerre.
It. to Robt Mayns∣worth thelder for ledyng of a fother of esshewode from Howghell hawghe to the Farmerre.

DIV2.P: S'ma patet.
Examinat. per Mr Wm todd Vicedecan.
Thomas Chylton.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 7105. 7 Sept., 1555.
DIV2.P: Carpenteres wyrkynge att the Dame two named John and Robt gallile. Several men at 8d., 7d., and 6d.; S'ma, liiijs.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3073, 3. 23 Jan., 1573.
DIV2.P: For makinge a synke thorowe charles moberleys wall of his lodgeinge into the farmerye (Three men's and a woman's wages: men at 6d. and 7d., woman at 2d.).

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3131. Voucher.
DIV2.P: The xiiijth of Maye Ao Dni 1586.

Payed and geauen vnto Wyllm Foster of Yorck in rewarde in consideracon of his paines in comynge for the makinge of the Eagle for the letterne of brasse in the Quier, See Hegg's Legend of St. Cuthbert, 1663, p. 89. xiijs. iiijd.
Signed, Tobie Matthew Dec.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3148. 22 Sept., 1586.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe. (Cuthb. Lyddell and others, sowder, harden cloth, corde for byndinge) xs. iiijd. ob.
Tobie Matthew Dec. Richerde Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3204, 4. 19 Dec., 1588.
DIV2.P: Mentions Mr. Pilkington's brewhowse, bellamys howse, cord, etc.
S'ma, xxvijs. ijd.
Leo. Pylkyngton Vicedea. Richard Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3204, 1-4. 22 Mar., 1588-9.
DIV2.P: 1. For amendinge the codythe at seu'all tymes sence Christenmes last past. Cuthbert Lyddell and others for work beyonde the Suspers See Glossary. Banke, in Holidays courten, the newe bridge, the west ende of the newe bridge and the hill beyond yt, layinge one pece of newe pype at the same ende of the brydge, sowder, halfe a pecke of salte, corde and tallowe.
S'ma, xjs. jd.
Leo. Pylkyngton, Vicedec. Richarde Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: 2. 18 Jun., 1589.
DIV2.P: A similar account. Mentions the bridge, Palmer close, the high wood, the banke beyond ye bridge, a day in Charley, Holydayes entrie, the abbay garth, corde for the condyth, vj poundes of Talloo, 2 yerdes of Harden clothe, xixs. jd. Signed as before.

DIV2.HEAD: 3. 26 Sept., 1589.
DIV2.P: Mentions the high wood, the Susper bank, the colledge garthe, soudering on the newe brydge, the newe brydge ende, ye Palmer close, sowder, corde, tallowe, and harden clothe.
Summa, xvijs. viijd.
Tobie Matthew Dec. Richarde Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3198.
DIV2.P: Payd xxviijo Septebris 1589. To the right worshipfull Mr Doctor Pilkington vicedeane And the chapter of Durham.

May it please yow to vnderstand right worshipfull that whereas yow have one pare of Orgaynes wch standeth above the Quere doore, & haith not bene played vpon thes many yeres for lacke of mendinge, I have bestowed a weekes labor in mendinge the sownd boord, the wynd stopp, the springe wyers, and in tuninge the pipes, so that I have mayd them in that good order as now they will much delight bothe the auditorie and the player because they yeld the most principallest and imperiall sound of all the rest. And if it seame strainge vnto yor worshipes that I have tayken in hand to doe it, yow shall vnderstand that I have had some practise in mendinge of an Instrument, and also I have geven diligence in markinge men of greater skill that haith bene here in tymes passed when they have been recompensed five markes or fortie shillinges for lesse paynes than I have taken (wch I referr to the quere) so that now I leve my paynes to yor good considera∣tions, for because I did not so much seeke after the recompence of rewarde as I did the excellencie of the Instrumente regarde, and as also that yow should see my redinesse & good will to indevour my selfe in what soevr I may to profitt or Churche.
Yors in whatt soevr he is able

Willam Smythe pettica'no'. William Smith was a composer as well as Pettycanon and amateur organ-builder, and was also organist 1588-1598. In one of the MS. organ∣books of the Cathedral are Kyries, Creeds, Preces and Psalms for different Festivals, Collects, and Anthems, by "Ds Smith, Clericus," described in the same book also as "William Smith."
Summa allocata in caplo vt ex altera parte pat., xxxs.
Endorsed, Willam Smithes Petitione. Alloc. xxxs. 3198.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232. 1-6.
DIV2.P: 1. 13 Mar., 1590-1. Mentions Mr Doctor Colmer his entrie, Palmerclose, the cundythe hede, the lonynge, the newe bridge ende, cord, etc.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232, 2. 13 Jun., 1591.
DIV2.P: For skowringe the two hedes of the condythe on the moore and in the highe wode, etc.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232, 3. 18 Jun., 1591.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythes qrter sence the An'untia∣c'on Last past, the loninge, ye pindfold, charley, &c.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232, 4. 24 Jul., 1591.
DIV2.P: For makinge newe pipes for the condithe, abowte a fyve score yerdes, and takinge vp that was . . . . . . broken in sundrie plaices, and layinge & placinge of the old that was better, burninge of the knottes & souderinge as foloeth.
Cuthbert Liddell and others labouring 34 days and two women 7½ days apiece, berynge of claye and sande; viij peckes of salte; clothe and tallowe to bynd in some places wher yt could not be sowdered.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232, 5. 25 Sept., 1591.
DIV2.P: Mendinge the condythe, cord, tallow, cloth, and labour.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3220. 28 Sept., 1591.
DIV2.P: For removinge the susper at the newe bridge ende, and bewldinge the same of newe, and for amendinge the susper in the highe wod.
Labourers at 8d., 7d., and 5d. a day, and two women at 3d.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3232, 6. 18 Dec., 1591.
DIV2.P: Mending, etc., at the lytle brydge, Mr Colmers entrie, the hither ende of the newe bridge, tallow, cord, and harden.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3251, 1, 2. 1. 28 Mar., 1592.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe sence Cristemes last past vnto thannu'tiac'on of or blessed ladie then next folowinge.

Cuthb. Lyddell, man, and labourer, at the lytle bridge, nighe to the pinfold, in palmer close, in the colledge garthe, for one stoone of tallowe, corde, and three yerdes of harden, xxjs. Accounts all signed by the Dean or Sub-Dean, and Richard Johnson.

DIV2.HEAD: 2. 23 June, 1592.
DIV2.P: Mending conduit from Lady Day. Cuthb., etc., at the chairlawe, in Mr Doctor Colmers gardinge, in the Colledge garthe, for corde, tallowe, and clothe, xviijs. xd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3273, 1, 2. 1. 28 Sept., 1592.
DIV2.P: Mending, etc., since Midsummer.

Cuthb., etc., at the Susper, (one labourer of Elvett moore, one of ye newbridge), in ye colledge garth, coorde, tallowe, and harden clothe; Tho. Patteson and Ric. Hodgeson for mendinge the seastern doore, xvjd., more for half an hundreth borde naile for the same, vd., xxxiiijs. vd.

DIV2.HEAD: 2. 16 Dec., 1592.
DIV2.P: Mending, etc., since Michaelmas. Cuthb., etc., at the litle bridge, at the pindfold, the newe bridge, the cundythe hede, for corde, to the bocher for a stoone of tallowe, for 3 yds. of harden clothe at 6d., xxjs. iijd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3307, 1-3. 1. 24 Mar., 1592-3.
DIV2.P: Cuthb., etc., in palmer close, in the colledge garthe, at ye condyth hed; corde for byndinge, 1 st. of tallowe, 4 yds. of harden clothe, xxiiijs. iijd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3341. 1. 28 March, 1593.
DIV2.P: For mendinge, etc., since Christmas. Cuthb. Lyddell, his man, and labourer, at the Susper, in Mr Fassettes stable, on the brydge and at the West yate; for corde of the Roper, for Tallowe bought of the bocher, for harden clothe.
S'ma, xvjs. ixd. All the vouchers are signed by the Dean or Sub-Dean, and Richard Johnson or another

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3131.
DIV2.P: Expencis for ye Cathedrall Church of Durism for mendinge, saudringe, and newcastinge ye west side of ye Church, ouer ye douescott, and part of ye Dortor leades, with sawdringe ye Ravestre leades since ye fifte of March vntill ye sixt of Apryll: An'o Do: 1593.

ROW.CELL: Cuthb. Hodson his man 13 days at 8d. ...
thre dussen pounde of sawder at 6d. ...
Reaph Younger for 3 dayes worke for phillitinge ye leades at 12d. ... ...
On thousand and a halfe of lead nayles at 6d. ye hundreth ... ... ... ...
On thousand of bord nayles at 10d. ... ...
On hundreth and a halfe of dubble spikines at 3s. 4d. ... ... ... ... ...

DIV2.P: Tobie Matthew Dec.
By me John Philpott, Sachriston.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3307. 2. 27 Apr., 1593.
DIV2.P: For makinge of newe pipes for the condythe and burninge the knottes of same layde betwen the newe bridge & the hill nighe therto, And also in Mr Doctor Colmers garding and to laborers, &c., sowder & salte occupied vpo' ye same. Cuthb. Lyddell and Cuthb. Hodgeson and labourers. Two wemen one daye to bere sande & claye, iiijd. 24 lb. sowder at 6d., 12s. thre peckes of Salte, ixd. lij. iijd.

DIV2.HEAD: 3. 22 June, 1593.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe at seu'all playces sence the Annu'tyac'on quarter last. Cuthb. Lyddell, labourer, and man, in the highe wodde, and in the Abbay garth; for corde, tallowe, and clothe. xvs. iiijd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3310.
DIV2.P:
Thes are to require & authorise you to paie to the bringer hereof Mr Broughe so muche money as maie (together wth that he hath receaued of yow alreddy) amount to ten poundes, for altering & amending of the Organes:
the rest he shall haue wch is xls. when he hath fully perfited the same. And this shalbe yor warrant. At Bereyk 14 of July 1593.
S'ma, vijli. xijs.
Tobie Matthew Dec.
To Mr D. Colmer Tresurer of Duresme.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3311. July xxth.
DIV2.P: Expencis for ye Cathedrall Church of Durisme for ye wrightes for makinge a frame with other imelmentes (implements?) therto for ye Orgaines and remouinge of them. Also for ye Smith for mendinge ye Clocke and Chime. 1593.
Inprimis for six dayes worke for Thomas Patison and Edward Storie at ye reat of viijd. ye day, viijs.
Item for Christopher Arrasmith for six dayes worke at vjd. ye daye, iijs.

Cuthb. Lyddelles man 4 days at 8d., 3s. 8d.; 100 nails, 10d.; mendinge ye Clocke, 14d.; busshinge of a ham'er, 8d.; six iron wedges for ye Chime, 18d.; layinge of a Cottrell with stele for ye barrell of ye Chime, 22d.; steleinge of a ham'er and too new lockes, 12d.; a Ceye for ye schole house dore, 6d.; makinge too new bandes for a stall, 8d.; makinge too new Chekes for a hammer, 6d.; makinge a new Cey for a plat locke in ye Church for ye bokes, 4d.; for 3 burden of Rishes, 6d.; for hearbes and flowers and Jeniper, 16d.
Some is xxijs. vjd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3329, 1-4. 1. 28 Sept., 1593.
DIV2.P: For yern woorke for the estgaite port' lodge, &c. To Robert Mallam for a new handle for the wycket of thest gayte, viijd.; for one newe locke for the porter lodge doore, xd. To him for a newe key for the Sesterne doore, iiijd. More for a key and a payre of wardes to the stott yate, iiijd. To him for a new key for Mr D. bayrnes for the newbridge, iiijd.
S'ma, ijs. vjd.

DIV2.HEAD: 2. 28 Sept., 1593.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe in seu'all plaices sence mydsomer Last past.
Cuthb., etc., in the charlaye, the palmerclose, at the susper, the newe brydge ende and in colledge and yarde; to the roper for corde, the bocher for tallowe, and 2 yds of harden clothe.
S'ma, xviijs. xd.

DIV2.HEAD: 3. 4 Dec., 1593.
DIV2.P: For a newe Ierne chimney for the exchecker. To Robert Lambe Lambe's shop was "upon Framygaite brige end."—Rites, ch. xxx. for yerne, and workinge of the same; the seyd chimney conteyninge twelve stoones of Ierne after ijs. a stoone of wrought Ierne. xxiiijs.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3326, 1. viijo die Decembr., 1593.
DIV2.P: For mendinge a broken glaswyndowe in the Thesorie howse.
To Edwarde Hodgeson glasyer for settinge (written over puttinge erased) the same in newe lede and puttinge therto halfe a foote of newe glas all conteyninge sex foote, ijs.
S'ma, ijs.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3329, 4. 14 Dec., 1593.
DIV2.P: For mending, etc. Cuthb., etc., in Mr Doctor Colmers entrie, at the wereyate, corde, etc., as above.
S'ma, xiiijs. vjd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3326, 2. xviijo die Dece'br. Ao d'ni 1593.
DIV2.P: For settinge vp a wyndhuse takinge downe of the gret orgayns caryinge of the same to the petican'ons hall and caryinge the same bak agayn and settinge vp in the former plaice and for skaffoldinge tymber worke and Ierne worke abowte the bellases.

Tho. Patteson, Cuthb. Hindmers, Edwarde Storie, Chr. Arrasmithe, Rauf Yonger, for some days at 8d. and 5d. To Robert lambe for a croke & a copereon for the rowle, and for nailes, ijs. vjd.; for ij traces for the belleses, ijd.
S'ma, xiiijs. vijd.
Signed by Dean and Sacristan.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3335.
DIV2.P: Ryght Woshepfull Mr Dene vnto you Espeshalli I desyer you{us} good frinshep in this my Request it is not vnbekoue to you{us} worsheps all that I haue taken long labor & graet payens wt you{us} graet Orgaens the wch hath bene both pa'ful & costly to me but I trust I haue don them to my credit & to you{us} good sarvis, for the wych I dow not dowt but you{us} worsheps all wylbe as wylling to consether me for my whell dowing as I have bene wylling to it.
S'ma, xls.
Tobie Matthew Dec.
Endorsed, Mr Broughe, 14 febr., 1593 (1593-4), 3335, xls.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 3341, 2. 15 Junii A.D. 1594.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe in severall plaices sence the feast of the Annu'tyac'on of or blessed ladye last.
Cuthb. Lyddell, man, and labourer, at the lytle bridge, at the Susper, in the palmer close, in ye charlawe, for tallowe, corde, and 3 yds. of harden clothe, xixs. jd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2765.
DIV2.P: xmo die mensis octobr. Anno D'ni 1595to.
Et sol. Joh'i Ricardson laboran' cu' Will'mo Organista See p. 733 n. in flaco'e organor. per tempus tonaco'is eor'd' viz. per ij dies ad iijd. in toto vjd.
Et Edwardo Jacson fabro pro nova factura j plaite de ferro pro le stoppes eor'd' organor. jd.
S'ma, vijd. per me Rom benett.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2703. xijo die Mrcij Ao d'ni 1596.
DIV2.P: For mendinge the condythe sence Christemes last in seu{us}all plaices as foloweth & one dayes worke of the lawer leades of the Checker.

(Cuthbert Lyddell and men in the colledge garthe, at the newe bridge ende, at the pinfoulde, in the palmer close, for mending leads when yt rayned in, and for sowder, to the roper for cord, and for tallow and cloth. xviijs. vd.).
W. James. Richarde Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 7104.
DIV2.P: Expencis for the Cathedrall Church of Durisme for nessesaries about ye same beinge ye xijth of November, Ano Dne 1596. Inprimis for a new cable rope for the great bell weyinge six ston and x pound at ye reat of iijs. iiijd. ye ston, xxijs (iiijd.). Item for 2 new psalters The Psalter was often published separate from the Prayer-book. ye on for George Barker and ye other for Christopher Smith at ye rate of vs. a psalter (xs.). Item for a new matte for ye quire to Christopher Arrasmith, xvjd.
S'ma, xxxiijs. xd.
W. James.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2679.
DIV2.P: Expences for the Cathedrall Church of Durisme for nescessaries about ye said Church ye fiftenth of February An'o D'ne (sic) 1596 (1596-7). Imprimis for fyve duessen of candell at ye rate of 4d. ye pound, xxs. Item for too great mates ye on for ye pue in ye quire and ye other for ye gentelwomen to knell on at morning prayer, ijs. viijd. Item for mendinge ye barrell of ye chyme to Maylen ye smith, viijd. Item for makinge cleane ye candelstikes. iiijd.
S'ma is xxiijs. iiijd.
W. James.
By me Joh. Philpott, Sachriston.

DIV2.HEAD: In bundle marked 7111. (Imperfect).
DIV2.P: . . for the Cathedrall Church of Durisme for nessisaries about ye same . . day of Aprill, An'o D'ni 1597. . . rishes against Easter last, beinge ye xxvijth day of March, iiijs. . . ye com'union church cloth and ye napkin, xijd. . . key for ye song schole dore to Maylen ye smith, vjd. . . xij yeardes of wyer for ye chyme at ijd. ye yeard, ijs. . . too barrs of Iron for ye windowes above ye ravestrie, xijd. . . for mendinge ye shaft of a ham'er of ye chyme, iiijd.
W. James. By me John Philpott, Sachriston.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2682. 24 Apr., 1597.
DIV2.P: For sawinge Sarkyn boordes and Swalles for the churche and the new bridge, xxijs. vjd.
W. James. Richarde Johnsonn.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2687. No date.
DIV2.P: For the Coundete. Fyrst Cuthbert Hodgson & Chr. Arrowsmith the viij & x of October ij daies on the mor, iijs. viijd. Itm for sowder spent ther, ijs. Itm the 25 & 27 of Octo. they tow daies in the Palmer Close, iijs. viijd. Itm for sowder spent ther, xxjd. Itm the 14, 19, and 15 of november they tow iij daies at the pynfowld and new bridge, vs. vjd. Itm for sowder spent ther, ijs. vjd.
Some, xixs. jd.

DIV2.HEAD: No. 2684. 30 May, 1597.
DIV2.P: For hewing, gittinge stone, and Caffolinge ye North Church dore.

Several men at 9d., 8d. and 6d. and four women at 3d. for work by the day, to the roper for 4 new tracis, for a hundreth of dubble spikines, do. of borde nailes, and a barrell to draw vpp lyme ine, lvs. 6d.

The following notes of expenses ought to have come in next after p. 719, but were overlooked in consequence of their being kept separately from the rest, framed and glazed in the Chapter Library. The frames are made of oak from the original boards of Bishop Pudsey's Bible. Dr. Raine has given extracts from the accounts in "St. Cuthbert," 178n., 179. He says that they were both "extracted from a bundle of bills in the Treasury for 1542, under which year are comprised the expences of the Church from Michaelmas, 1541, to the same day in the following year." The short note of a payment of 15d. to "Rayffe Skelus" (also printed by Raine in his note on p. 178 above referred to) was found by me among the miscellaneous charters.

DIV2.HEAD: Post festum divi Michaelis. Die Sci. Andree (1541-2).
DIV2.P: In primis, dat. Joh'i Younger de Claporthe pro 3li. cere et 3 qar ad 5d. a pounde, 19d.
It. solut. Joh'i Symson pro ablacione tumbe S. Cuthberti et tumbe S. Bede pro 4or diebus, 2s.
It. solut. eidem pro suo filio (ad 3d.) et Roberto Shefeyld pro totidem diebus (ad 3d.), 2s.
It. solut. eidem pro Hugone Foster pro 2us diebus ad 3d., 6d.
It. solut. Henrico Kyngston pro se (ad 5d.) et servo Cuthberti Jonson (ad 4d.) pro 2us diebus penes ly kyll Roberti Tomson, 18d.
It. solut. Joh'i Younger 3 Decembris pro 1 lib. cere, 5d.
It. solut. Wyll'mo Ade pro factura 4d. et 8li. cere, 18d. (sic).

It. solut. Georgio Elyson 4to Decembris pro 5 diebus, scilicet 3us diebus penes Christoferum Brounes et Joh'em Lames, et 1 die penes Rychardum Rawe, et altera die apud Haghehems (?) pro se (ad 4d.) et suo laboratore (ad 3d.), 2s. 11d.
It. solut. Wyll'mo Guse (ad 6d.) et Edwardo Wattson (ad 4d.) pro 2us diebus apud molendinum de Raynton, 20d.
It. solut. fabro ferrario pro on yern shoull pro car∣bonibus in ecclesia, 2d.

It. solut. Wyll'mo Gallele pro servo apud Hesyldon myll, 2s., et pro se 6d., etiam pro ly armes for ye iner wheyll, 16d., So at Winston about the same time; p. 720. et pro spykynges, 6d., summa, 4s. 4d.
Compar. Summa, 18s. 7d.
Per me Robertum Dallton. First Prebendary of the Seventh Stall.

DIV2.HEAD: Cart. Misc., No. 2730. No date.
DIV2.P: Also payd to Rayffe Skelus and iij fellows for takyng away sanct bedes tumbe, xvd.
(Signed Raphe blakeston). First Prebendary of the Tenth Stall.

DIV2.HEAD: Post festum Michaelis (1541-2).
DIV2.P: Circa S. Cuthbertum. Dat. Georgio Skeles 1 die Januarii pro 2 diebus et dimidia (sic) circa facturam putei S. Cuthberti, 15d. It. dat. eidem pro Johanne Paxton (ad 3d.), Johanne Wyll'amson (3d.), Johanne Oxenett (3d.) pro duobus diebus et dimidia, 22d. ob. It. dat. eidem pro Will'mo Tayller (ad 3d.) pro 1 die et dimidia, 4d. ob. It. dat. Cuthberto Jonson pro 2us et dimidia, 15d.

Circa Beyrparke. It. dat. Georgio Skeles pro Joh'e Lame seniore (ad 5d.), et pro Joh'e Lame juniore ad 4d., pro Henrico Huchynson (ad 4d.) et pro servo Joh'is Lame pro uno die apud Beyrparke, et pro 100 lattbroddes, 20d.

Circa S. Cuthbertum. It. dat. pro 5 ulneis linie pro 1 sheytt ad 8d. 1 ulnea, 3s. 4d. It. dat. pro 1 loyde calcis, 4d. It. dat. Stokell pro clavis et ligamentis ferreis, 4d. It. dat. Georgio Skeles pro 4or diebus in festo Epiphanie circa sepulcram (sic) Sci. Cuthberti, 2s. 2d. aurora 1d. It. dat. eidem pro Joh'e Paxton, Joh'e Wyll'amson, Joh'e Oxenet 4or diebus ad 3d., et pro aurora cuilibet 1d. et pro Wyll'mo Tayler 3 diebus et aurora 1d., et pro Rychardo Yggle et Rolando Robson dimidia diei, 4d., 4s. 5d. It. dat. Cuthberto Jonson pro se et servo 3us diebus circa sepulcram S. Cuthberti, et circa lapidem marmoreum, et circa ecclesiam propter ventum, 2s. 3d. Item dat. illius uxori pro sheuyng (sewing) off a sheytt, 3d.

Pro Byllyngame. It. dat. Thome Chepman crastina Epiphanie pro tectura horrii vicarii de Byllyngam, 4s. 4d. It. dat. eidem pro reparacione tythebarne gayttes, 6d., et pro sera cum clave for ye qerdoyr, 6d., pro reparacione fenestre cum vitro ibidem, 8d., 20d.
Compar. Summa, 24s. 5d.
Per me Robertum Dallton.

DIV2.HEAD: The following passage in the Hostillar's Roll of 1346-7 should have appeared in p. 118, being interesting as having afforded to the N.E.D. a quotation for Grass silver.
DIV2.P: Gressiluer. Et Thome Fossore seniori [and seven others] quolibet capiente 7s. 4d., 58s. 8d.
Et in herbagio empto pro Joh'e de Haliden, hospit. supervenient. et equis Hostillarii, 11s.
Summa, 69s. 8d.
On the back of the roll is a Status officii of the usual kind, and one of the manor of Elvethall; at the end of the latter is the following memorandum:—
Semen seminatum. 6 quarter. 6 bus. frumenti; 12 quarter. 1 bus. di. ordii; 20 quarter. aven.; 1 quarter. 6 bus. pis.
